Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: KellyLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms in early January. My mother had a king-sized room, and we had 2 queens. Both rooms, but esp. the king, felt nice and spacious, and both had nice bay views with balconies. The staff were very gracious and friendly. I was worried because I couldn't find my booking/confirmation number prior to arrival, but no worries -- just by giving my last name, they quickly pulled up all the info. We ate breakfast at the more-than-adequate hot buffet on both mornings. Food was tasty, esp. the eggs, and I wasn't too concerned that there wasn't a lot of variety between the days...for a free buffet, this was a great value. Service in the buffet restaurant was also very good, with the waiter bringing frequent coffee/soda refills. Sorry that we didn't get to experience either the dining room for dinner, or the pool/jacuzzi, but it was a quick stay, and most of our time was spent out of the hotel. Speaking of which, the location was tucked away from the hubbub of greater San Diego, but was also super convenient and central for playing tourist. Will definitely choose again for future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Silver54
Reviews.Content: Was at the Bay Inn March 21st thru 23rd. Very nice place, the rooms are beautiful decorated, beds nice. The buffet was awesome (eggs, toast, sausage, bacon, juice, coffee) well worth the price of the hotel. We had a beautiful kind room with a balcony on the 2nd floor with a view of the bay, was great to sit out there sip coffee and watch the boats go by. We got a great price being winter don't know what the prices would be summer. The hotel staff was very nice and I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel for the Hard to Please Person”
Reviews.Author: NL222
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent and friendly staff, great location, full breakfast buffet worth the $5 parking fee, comfortable bed and clean rooms. I'm usually very picky on where I stay when I travel, and read many reviews before booking here. I choose this hotel because of other reviews from trip advisor. I was pleased with the hotel and that the reviews did not disappoint. Very nice place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Club Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VikkiluluCP
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Bay Club for many years now and we are never disappointed. The hotel staff is acommodating and friendly, the food and drinks are great. We love the free buffet breakfast. The pool and jacuzzi are always sparkling clean as is the entire hotel! I highly recommend the Bay Club Hotel! Shelter Island is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “All around AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I took a chance the Bay Club by reading the previous reviews and I was not dissapointed at all! Very clean, extremely nice workers and a very good breakfast spread. The view was was beautiful and location second to none. My wife and I were very pleased and we will be back... Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the Bay Club Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coopershawk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from another excellent 4 day stay at the Bay Club. Every time we go to San Diego this is our hotel of choice. We had a room on the second floor facing the marina and the location was quiet, the room was clean and of course the staff was all top notch! You can't beat the location...so relaxing! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Matt T
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly, prices can't be beat, excellent location, the comp. breakfast is so much better than any other free breakfast i've had elsewhere. Second time staying there and will do so every trip back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Small but WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: chamblyn
Reviews.Content: Our experience began before we actually got to the hotel. Between jet lag & a head cold I wasn't feeling real good but Patrick(who picked us up at the airport) made me feel welcome & gave us lots of good tips. Our room was very spacious with partial bay view. Breakfasts were so convienent & delicious! All the staff were extremely helpful & pleasant, especially Patty! She helped us with getting tickets for the trolley & almost daily directions. We left the hotel to visit family in Camarillo, only to return 2 days later for the remainder of our stay in San Diego. Our 2nd room was even bigger than the first. We asked at the front desk if we could get a microwave & it was brought right up. The surrounding area is great-across the street from the bay & a nice park with clean walking path. We travel often & always look for the "best deal". In our opinion the Bay Club & its' employees are truly the "BEST"!! Thanks again for a fantastic experience, hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean large room, good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: SezzaBrissie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Bay Club hotel in a Bay view room. While the hotel was an older style everything was spotless and the rooms were large. We found the Marina a great place to stay away from the hustle and bustle but most attractions were less than a 10 minute drive. The breakfasts were good although has a person with dietary requirements a 3 day stay there meant I was a bit limited on options. It would be great if there was some yoghurt and some rice or corn based cereals available. The service was also good. I would love to return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was concerned about this establishment because the price was so good, but it turned out to be a great place to stay! I was in town on business and brought my family with me. It was clean, quiet, and not far from where I had to go to work. Just across the street from a decent park. Breakfast was ok too. The only drawback was the hotel rooms seemed to be decorated in the 80's and not updated since. Can't complain one bit. We enjoyed our stay. Definitely will recommend to friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, . . . ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NsjoyceM
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. However, the decor is a bit "tired." The rooms were clean and comfortable but a bit tired looking. The staff were very courteous. The breakfasts were very good. A good value for the location. I enjoyed walking by the bay and seeing the seals and pelicans. It was relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Dining Experience”
Reviews.Author: JustBeHonest
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed here, but we entertained a large group at this hotel for dinner in a private room. Be advised that this is far from a "fine dining" experience. For starters, they didn't act much like they were expecting us even though we were the ONLY customers. To make matters worse, the food was cold and just not very good. To make matters worse, the room smelled musty. Very much a cheap hotel atmosphere. Also, larger group dining rooms are very old and decor is outdated. Unfortunately, I now have to apologize to my guests for the food and the atmosphere. I was frankly shocked at my experience given the reviews on sites like Open Table.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: dave h
Reviews.Content: I picked the Bay Club off the net and was very pleased. The check in could not have been better with the young lady probably the most courteous front-desk clerk I've ever experienced. The room is basic but very comfortable. You really can't beat the location for convenience and quiet. I would suggest requesting a room on the 2nd floor (the family of elephants above us was somewhat annoying.) The included breakfast is very nice with a lovely view of the marina. Thank you Ismaele for keeping us well supplied with coffee and juice! There is plenty of underground parking. I would definitely stay there again. Room has a fridge and there is a liquor store not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexCanuck
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a week and we found the rooms, staff and overall feeling of the hotel to bed very good. Wonderful location, very polite and helpful staff. The rooms were quite spacious and clean. The breakfast was pretty similar everyday but very good. Lots of fresh fruit. The parking was excellent and very cheap! The area was great and it is so centrally located to everything, (zoo, sea world, midway museum, etc) we drove about 15 min max to get anywhere. I would stay here again, without hesitation. The gym is small but good. Try not to stay near room 109, laundry is underneath it so we had to move to the second floor, more expensive but worth it. We are a bit noise sensitive esp in the am. The hot tub could have been hotter and pool could have been warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Andy E
Reviews.Content: We loved the peacefulness of the Marina view. It was great waking up every morning to the sound of birds and the perfect temperature of San Diego. The hotel itself is a little dated but overall our experience was very relaxing. We would recommend it to those looking for nice and peaceful rather than fancy or flashy. The complimentary breakfast was fine and we did enjoy the hot tub each night. Good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Family fun”
Reviews.Author: coco4mere
Reviews.Content: We were quite happy to discover our room had a beautiful view of the city across the bay and was quite spacious. Also, if you like plenty of hot water in the shower, this is the place to go. Rarely did we hear any hallway noise and we never heard any other rooms. As stated by others, the hotel is convenient to everything and the staff friendly and helpful. The kids looked forward to the full breakfast buffet everyday. The kids also loved the pool, which is heated, but still felt chilly to most adults who preferred the whirlpool. There were plenty of towels handy. We also enjoyed the beach across the street in the morning to walk and look for shells.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Area”
Reviews.Author: Doug80904
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 4 days at the Bay Club and I can't imagine a better place to stay in San Diego, if you are into a more laid back area like Shelter Island. The hotel was clean and the staff all friendly. My room in many ways felt brand new. The views of the Bay and the Marina are spectacular. Awesome breakfast buffet, and with half price starters for happy hour, one can eat for very little. I throughly enjoyed myself. Any trip to San Diego in the future, I will be staying at the Bay Club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old fashioned family hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: DMF3758
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully situated on Shelter Bay with a view across the water to San Diego on one side and a view of the Marina on the other. There is a bar terrace with a small outdoor swimming pool and hot tub. Check-in staff are friendly and efficient. The rooms are spacious, clean and well equipped. Most of the patrons are retirees and families so this is not the hotel to be in if you are after a wild time and the feeling of the hotel is conservative and old-fashioned, but that will be a plus for many. The pricing is very reasonable and although I had to leave a day earlier than planned they did not charge me for the extra day. The free breakfast is varied and generous and the bar snacks and food of excellent quality for the price. The only negative I found was the barman who was the rudest person I met in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The staff was amazing (many interacted with our 4 year old son which I loved). The location cannot be beat. When my son saw how close we were to the sand and water, he started jumping up and down. The complimentary breakfast was delicious. The rooms are very spacious and you cannot beat the views (we booked a Bay view room). My husband, son, and I enjoyed relaxing in the jacuzzi after a long day of sight seeing. The only problem I had was the first night I was awaken at 3am by the sounds of the seals barking (but the hotel has no control over that and honestly, we are in their territoty). I honestly do not think I could ever stay at another hotel in San Diego, none of them will even compare.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but noisy”
Reviews.Author: finewine57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bay Club for a business conference in San Diego. The hotel where the conference was located had poor ratings on TripAdvisor, so I decided to stay at this higher rated hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The parking was plentiful and easy to access. The buffet breakfast was delicious, hot, and maintained...all things that make a hotel stay wonderful. There were two issues, neither of which were under the control of the hotel, that had me wishing I had stayed elsewhere. The hotel is located on Shelter Island which is in the San Diego bay, directly across from North Island Naval Air Station. During my stay, there was a large amount of air traffic, mostly helicoptor traffic, that was extremely noisy. My balcony was open towards the source of the noise, thus funneling the noise into my room. Luckily, the majority of the noise was during daylight hours. Also in the noise category, this hotel's room layout is designed such that the TV set in one room is located along the same wall that the adjoining room's bed is located. Unfortunately, my neighbor was a late night television viewer with an obvious hearing problem...luckily by turning the wall mount AC unit on high, I was able to mask the majority of the TV noise. The second issue is regarding the WiFi capabilities at this hotel. They offer free WiFi. Upon arrival, you are told that the free WiFi is limited in speed (I found it to be slower than an old dial-up modem). They offer WiFi with increased speed for a premium (actually provided by a third party provider known as sandiegowirelessservices.com). Because I do a lot of my business via a VPN hookup with my corporate LAN, a decent WiFi speed is a necessity. So, I paid for the increased speed. The result was a negligable speed increase (slightly above the speed of an old dial-up modem). I have contacted the third party provider to let them know...it could be a simple equipment probelm. In summary, this is a wonderful hotel with great service. I just happened to be there during a very active Naval aviation period. It was fun to watch the air traffic and feel the noise, but it soon grew annoying (my opinion...obviously I'm getting old!!). Also, if you do business via the internet while travelling, this location may be a problem due to slow WiFi speeds.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego trip to whale watch”
Reviews.Author: Marsha H
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, delicious buffet breakfast, great dinner selections, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Club on Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: MikeinNapa
Reviews.Content: We have family on Point Loma and we have stayed at the Bay Club a number of times. It has a great location on Shelter Island. We like to take a long walk along San Diego Bay in the morning to watch the sunrise over the water. We like the easy walking distance to excellent restaurents. The staff is friendly and helpful. It is not a luxury hotel, but it is clean and the price is reasonable and includes a great full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy H
Reviews.Content: This hotel had it all..... great view of the bay and marina. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast that is included in the hotel price was fabulous!! It was a full breakfast had something for everyone. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay there again. I am a local that was just looking for a nice place to relax for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Eric F
Reviews.Content: I wanted to do something special for my wife's b-day. Since we were traveling to SoCal to visit family and friends (we live in Madison, WI), I thought it'd be fun to go to San Diego. Grandparents got to babysit the kids in LA, and we headed south for 3 three days. The Bay Club Hotel was exactly as advertised on their site. I also read many reviews from travelers on Tripadvisor.com. The staff was friendly and very helpful, the room was large, clean, and faced the marina. We enjoyed the island decor. A little dated? Sure, but having granite bathroom countertops is not a high priority for us. As we checked in, we asked about restaurants in the area. They happily gave suggestions and also gave us a 20% discount to their restaurant. Since we had spent the day ay Balboa Park, Cabrillo Park, and wandering around tidepools, we decided to take them up on their suggestion. The food was excellent! My wife had the scallop and shrimp scampi. Fresh and perfectly prepared. I had the fish tacos. Yum! We're fish snobs :-) Lots of windows facing the marina. Since this was a special occasion, they had brought champagne to our room five minutes after we checked in. What a surprise! Breakfast was plentiful with potatoes, two types of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and pancakes (the next day was french toast). A few cups of coffee too. We are not muffin and orange juice people. Staff was there to refill coffee or juice and remove plates. Another traveler whose post I read talked about going for a walk by the water. We did too. Watched the sun come up, birds swimming, magical. Parking was easy and inexpensive. Last but not least, the price was superb. We stayed during the week so it was cheaper. I highly recommend the Bay Club Hotel to anyone: families, couples, singles. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing experience with the best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: BeckitaMontana
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bay Club every time I come to San Diego. It is so peaceful - only 2 stories, wonderful rooms and beds, great breakfast, bar and pool. You can have a room that faces the bay or the marina. In the morning and/or evening before you take advantage of the fabulous city, take a long stroll along the bay and watch the wildlife and the activities of Pt. Loma.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Get away”
Reviews.Author: travlerfromtheoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to celebrate our anniversary/ Valentine's Day and take a weekend trip the Bay Club Hotel. Upon check in, the front desk crew was cheerful and extremely friendly. Our room was spacious and our view was amazing! We had a dinner in the hotel restaurant. The view in the dining room was fantastic, food excellent, and the service was warm and friendly. Thank you Amanda, Heather and John (I think this was the bartenders name?) for making our stay special and spectacular! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Exciting”
Reviews.Author: HDTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 2 views to pick from...marina or the bay. Marina side is quiet and the Bay side is beautiful. I prefered the Bay side. Staff is very helpful, (especially Jody) Continental breakfast in the mornings. Eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes, pancakes and cold cereals. Juice , coffee and milk. Everyone was very friendly and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: SarahJFisk
Reviews.Content: My assistant double booked me at this hotel and another nearby. Since I needed to be at the other location, I needed to cancel this one. When it came down to it, Aaron bent the rules for me and was very understanding. Next time I am going to Shelter Island, I will definitely stay with Bay Club!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: eltorreta67
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay here the staff was very friendly. it is a older hotel but it was stll nice had a wonderful view of the bay. we left our sliding door open at night and early mornings we could here the sea lions it was really cool. our bartender John was awesome great memory. not a big place thats what made it more personal. would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in San Diego. Right on the Bay with good views and a park for walking and running on the bay. Customer service is excellent. They helped me with printing out my boarding pass. Breakfasts are good. Rooms large. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Robin W
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Bay Club Hotel & Marina in San Diego. Although this is an older property, it is well maintained and very clean. We were greeted by a very friendly staff. Our room was ready early and we had a gorgeous view of the harbor. The free buffet breakfast was delicious. We hope to return for a stay in August. Thank you for a wonderful two nights. Robin

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 'Hidden Jewel' on Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: NewportBeachWords
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this 'private clubby' little Resort, since I was in grade-school w/ my parents. (Really dating my self...) Lately, I've had the opportunity to be in S.D. on a rotating basis, and have chosen this dreamy Shelter Island spot, once more. The property is small so you avoid the irritating crowds and 'hoards', that flock to larger hotels around town. Having belonged to Yacht Clubs in my youth, I can report there is the very same 'feel' about this property - minus the Monthly Dues attatched! Wonderful Marina below, and the central Lobby is very cozy, featuring a Fireplace and small Lounge area. There is a formal Dining-room w/ great waterfront views, though I mostly take my meals in the Lounge area around fireplace. Waitstaff eager to please and VERY friendly - ask for 'Laurie', a regular w/ the Club of 8 years. There is a DAILY Brkfst. Buffet provided for Resort guests, also good. The rooms themselves are older, but still retain the same charm I fondly remember as a child. An added perk? Catch all the great music from next door @ 'Humphery's' Jazz series. Just head for the pool area, grab a cocktail and enjoy the concert(s) - NO cover involved!!! Catch all the San Diego bayfront action, right outside Lobby door - just across street! In a word...... 'paradise'.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in SD.”
Reviews.Author: Aschexn
Reviews.Content: Not super fancy, but just right. Great views, great location and great complimentary breakfast. Like others have said, not just your typical cereal and muffins. We had a wonderful time and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ron-diane
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Bay Club for fifteen years. Where else will you get either a full view of the yacht basin or ships coming and going in San Diego Harbor? The hot breakfast buffet is free. The neighborhood is quiet and the hotel is conveniently located within reach of all of San Diego's features. The cost is less than you would pay at a Hampton or Courtyard. Upgrading at the hotel seems to be a constant ongoing process. You cannot ask for a friendlier or more helpful staff. Lunches and dinners are served in the bar and bayview dining room. We would not stay anywhere else. Our friends who have tried it agree.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel across the street from the beach”
Reviews.Author: TooSmart
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that is a little outdated but makes up for it. The free breakfast was wonderful. Not the typical cold stuff but hot foods too and great service. You should not expect a great view from your room here, so just plan on being outside. The beach is across the street but is perfect for a early morning walk. The area is a strange one, sometimes attracting homeless types that sleep on the beach, but nothing too bad. We had to stay here for a wedding so I would probably not have chosen it. I loved the staff and the beach walks and the breakfast. I would probably not choose to stay here unless it was convenient. It was not a vacation hotel for sure to me.

Reviews.Title: “The best value on Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: 42n81z
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Bay Club since 1995. It's a super value, great staff,super breakfast included in the room rate. We recommend you to. Insider the rest then book here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Melinda G
Reviews.Content: We visited the Bay Club Hotel in November just before Thanksgiving. It was our first trip to San Diego. We decided on this hotel based on the numerous good reviews here. I have to say we were not dissapointed. The staff was wonderful and gracious! Yes, the hotel is a bit older but I already expected that. I even expected the great staff. However, I was incredibly pleased to find out that their food was also spectacular. We ended up eating there every night for dinner (happy hour from 4-7 = 1/2 price appetizers!) They were so good and the price was much less than I expected it to be, I expecially recommend the crab cakes and the coconut shrimp. Yes the breakfasts do get a bit boring after a couple of days but it is FREE and HOT, how can you ask for more in San Diego where most hotels charge an arm and a leg for food and parking. Another plus were the guests themselves. We met some wonderful people, it was a mix of those also on vacation and beleive it or not people who were actually living on their boats in the marina. Everyone was friendlly and I expect we will actually visit one of the other couples we met there on another vacation! Now for the room. We have a 7 yr old girl who loves boats and dolphins so we opted to take a risk and stay on the Bay side. If you have a child who likes boats I highly recommend it. Do get a 2nd floor room though, I have a feeling it would be harder to see the boats on the first floor. We saw several Navy ships sail by and at night you can walk on the Bay and hear the seals barking, we even saw them swimming in the water. It was one of our trip highlights - and we didn't even have to leave the area! Once you close the balcony door the noises dissapeared and it was plenty quiet to sleep. Humphries next door even had a concert going on one of the nights and we didn't hear a thing. Long story short - if you want a good hotel with great staff at an even better price, stay at the Bay. I won't even look for another hotel on our next visit - we're going straight to the Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: DougPdx
Reviews.Content: Nice 3 night stay in January '12. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Nice pool area and jacuzzi, unfortunately not warm enough to sit outside at night, but would be nice area if weather were warmer. Buffet breakfast was good. Handy location, with car, to do all our day trips. Parking $5/night which is reasonable in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: HawthorneHotelGM
Reviews.Content: As a fellow hotel general manager, I have very high expectations of great service, and this place delivered perfectly. Everyone we encountered was super friendly, and any request was met with an immediate and perfect response. We stayed there twice, once when they didn't know who I was, and the second time when they did, and both stays were perfect. The breakfast that comes with the room was excellent, and the salsa is the BEST!! We also really liked the bacon, and the fact that the fruit was served nice and cold was a bonus. The only thing we think should be improved is the water pressure in the shower, which was on the weak side. The decor is a bit dated, but who cares! It is clean, comfortable, and a good value. You will not be sorry if you chose this as a place to stay. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Nandan S
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent staff and is very helpful in arranging staff and bending the rules. Clean and breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful; and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: Quiet, pool (85 degrees in Jan); hot tub, fridge, the staff was friendly, the room was large, great bed and the room was spotless. I couldn't get over the price of the package deal which included a dinner for two and breakfast. And the dinner is any entree on the menu (and delicious). And a marina view to boot! This place was recommended by a co-worker, and we were not disappointed. I have announced to all my friends on facebook how great this place is and how reasonably priced. For those of us middle class people, with not a lot of extra in our pockets, to get this kind of getaway for a reasonable price was a treat. Great pina colada's by the way. Only downside; our room was right next to Humphrey's and on the weekends the music is playing until late; not horribly loud, but you could hear it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: Julia C
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club was a great find for our 4-day trip 2nd honeymoon to San Diego. It's close enough to town that it's convenient to drive in, but definitely away from the noise. We slept great. Our room had a great view of the marina and parking was easy on site right outside the lobby. Breakfast was included and awesome - it was a full breakfast with eggs, sausage, potatoes, etc. We checked in after midnight and it was a breeze getting to our room. The room was clean and we were definitely comfortable. The furnishings were more than adequate for what we needed but could probably use some updating before too long. We found the staff to be very helpful and all-around it was an easy, wonderful experience. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Eric F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I keep going back to the Bay club almost every year after a visit with the grandchildren in Az. It is quiet and the staff are always very friendly and helpful. We love the Bay Club. The view from our room was great of the Bay and the San Diego skyline. Every place you may want to go to in San Diego is easy to get to from the Bay Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired linens”
Reviews.Author: SLPlovesPE42
Reviews.Content: The location and view of the marina is wonderful! The odd (mothball? pest spray?) smell in the room, not so much. The bedding was clean but worn, as was the bathroom tiling and flooring. The bathtub faucet dripped continuously. There was dark/short hair around the sink (and that does not describe either my mother's or my hair!) Our ground-level room's outside sitting area was in full view of the restaurant in the middle of the hotel, making it not at all private or comfortable to be out there. The buffet breakfast was nice. The staff were helpful and friendly, which is always appreciated. If you want a great location/view from your room with included buffet breakfast, but you're not fussy about the room per se, this is probably a good choice for you. However for the price, I liked the Homewood Suites San Diego/Liberty Station that I stayed at in March better.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Bay Club”
Reviews.Author: fromaztocali
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. Clean, cheap parking (compared to downtown San Diego hotels), right across the street from a perfect place for kids to play. And the rooms are very spacious, plenty of room for your suitcases. The staff is super friendly and helpful and the breakfast is awesome. The Bay Club is always our San Diego hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: K M
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights - Dec 23 & Jan 1. Staff was really nice. Airport transportation was quick. Highlights - Enjoyed the walks across from the hotel along the bay. Also, enjoyed waking up to the view of the bay from the room. Thanks Patrick for the nice room. We reached early and got to leave/store our bags & do an early check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roxie320
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel all my family goes to in San Diego. The staff is so friendly, and they even remembered all of us from our last trip a few months ago! We've had a birthday party for about 50 people and also a lunch following a memorial service for about 60 people. Both events worked out very well. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The food and drinks were good. Plus the location of this hotel is nice. Beautiful for my morning walk. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting San Diego in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We live locally, and will go back!”
Reviews.Author: Joepassal1
Reviews.Content: Service was first class, food was great! Our room was a mini suite, the room and dinner package is a great deal! We sat in our room and watched sail boats in the bay! Highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “1st Family trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Stacy M
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from the midwest and just completed our first trip to California. We stayed at the Bay Club from 12/26 to 12/28 and could not have been more pleased! We checked in around 11am and our room was ready for us. We had a lovely room that overlooked the Marina. The boats at night were decorated with Christmas lights and decorations. It was beautiful! Parking was $5 per day and the room came with a refrigerator and in-room safe. Complimentary breakfast was also included and consisted of eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes either waffles or french toast, cereal, engish muffins, breads, oatmeal, coffee and juices. The servers at the breakfast were wonderful and they refilled our drinks and cleared our plates promptlyl. We visited the Zoo and Seaworld during our stay and both were within 20 minutes from the hotel. Tons of dining options both near the hotel and in the downtown area of San Diego. Also very close to the San Diego airport without the airport noise. Rooms seemed a little dated, but definitely well maintained. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Susie S
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for several days recently and had a wonderful stay. The location was convenient to most parts of the city (10 minutes to Mission Beach and downtown areas, 15 minutes to the zoo and La Jolla); the room was extremely spacious; the breakfast buffet (included with room) was great. Parking was a very reasonable $5. Best of all was the excellent service from all hotel employees. The breakfast servers were efficient and polite. The front desk staff answered numerous questions helpfully. One evening we had to call about the noisy guests in the room next door; security was at their room within five minutes, asking them to quiet down. Another day we had a maintenance issue in the room, and someone was there to fix it within 10 minutes. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: woods_d
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I stayed here 12/23-12/30 and had a wonderful time. This hotel is on Shelter Island. It has a beautiful view of the bay and other side is the Marina side. All of the staff go out of their way to make sure you have a vacation of your dreams at their hotel . A few people I would like to give a special thank you to are Brandi, Jody, Amanda , Raul and everyone else [sorry if I didn't remeber the names] all of you gave great service and always a smile and helpful tips.The breakfast buffet in the mornings was very good and your chicken tortia soup was the best I have had. The location of this hotel is execellent you can get anywhere within 5-15mins depending on your travels.I will always remeber the beautiful time we had in San Diego thanks to the wonderful hotel and special staff. The hot tub at night was great to have after a long day playing in your beautiful city . thanks again Dee & Tom loved rm 253

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Views, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mscapehorn
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Greeted by a friendly and helpful desk clerk. Room was a good size, was clean, had a balcony, and a wonderful view of the marina. Lounge had a fireplace going for happy hour and it looks out onto the pool and the marina. It also has a nice bar. Service was a bit annoying, as it seemed like if you were not a regular or a local, you were ignored and not treated as friendly as the regs. But the drinks were good! Parking was easy and reasonable. A hot and cold breakfast buffet is included with the room and was great, especially sitting in the comfy dining room with great views. I loved it here and not only will i come back...i can't wait to visit again. Oh, location is easy access to the airport and Old Town!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Hoss03
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, it was very convenient as we had a car and after a busy days sightseeing it was like a vacation from the vacation to come back and enjoy our view across the bay of navy ships , airforce planes , fisherfolk and to enjoy a walk along the waterfront. The room was generously sized and well equipped and very clean. WIfi free and a safe also. The full buffet breakfast -Great . All of thestaff -front office ,restaurant and housekeeping should be applauded for their superb customer service . I would love to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, outstanding price”
Reviews.Author: Silicon_Valley_Guy1
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel in early December. I requested and got a room on the second floor facing San Diego Bay. Fortunately the weather was terrific - cool, crisp and sunny. The room as requested came with 2 queen beds - was spacious. The balcony was small but large enough to sit in a chair and read and the view was outstanding. Morning sunrises and evening sunsets. The bathroom was well equipped and spacious. Standard closet, dressers and TV arrangement. But then I was not there to watch TV. The location is excellent - located on a what amounts to a man-made breakwater facing the San Diego bay. I had no problem with noise during my visit, but I will admit the walls are on the thin side. A complete breakfast buffet was included in the price of the room and included everything you could want in a US style breakfast buffet. Parking for my rental car in an underground garage was $5/day additional. However the room price was fantastic for a hotel in San Diego with a view of the bay during a weekend in December. While it is great to take a walk along the bay side of Harbor Island, that is about all there is within easy walking distance of the hotel, so you will need a rental car for sightseeing around San Diego. Above and beyond the call of duty: The morning before I flew home I went to the front desk to see if would be possible for someone to print out my boarding pass at the appropriate time so I would get early boarding. Since I was planning to be out sightseeing the entire day I needed their help. The lady at the desk was quite happy to do that for me and frankly I was very impressed with her customer service. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda L
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Best Western a few doors down, but decided to give this hotel a try for something different and based on the reviews I read on TripAdvisor. When I arrived at the hotel for check-in, I was immediately greeted/acknowledged by the front desk clerk (wish I'd paid more attention to her nam) who was very friendly. Check-in went quick and she told me she would send Patrick up right away with the extra amenity I'd purchased. When reserving my room on the website, I'd asked for a room with a fabulous view of the bay and that's what they gave me. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to enjoy the view because it was getting dark by the time I checked in and the next morning it was fairly hazy. My room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The only problem I encountered was that I could never get the heater to work right. I should've called the front desk to have someone check it, but I didn't. Also, I would've liked it more had there been video check-out, but I guess since my room wasn't far from the front desk, it was no big deal to have to go there to check-out. And it was nice that Judy had remembered me from the night before, even though she hadn't been the one to check me in (she'd been at the front desk at the time). Everyone I encountered was very nice. When Patrick brought my amenity, he offered to go get some ice for me while I settled in. The interior of the hotel was quiet, which was nice I didn't hear people talking and slamming doors shut all night, but I happened to be awake at about 1:15am and could hear people socializing loudly in the parking lot. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone I knew visiting the area and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very rude waitstaff in dining area.”
Reviews.Author: Des0510
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and in a great location. Everyone was very nice until we went down to the bar one night to grab some food and the lady, I believe Heather, was very very rude. I was very offended in the way we were treated. We may stay at the hotel again, but will defiantly stay away from the dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & value”
Reviews.Author: BethJo_11
Reviews.Content: After some research we found this Hotel on Shelter Island. It has the ocean across the street and the marina to the back. It was an excellent hotel for my daughter & myself. Felt very safe - next to Point Loma & Naval base. Our room was spacious and the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. The breakfast was a buffet - scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, fruit, cereal, bagels, juice & very good. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We even had a spider on our wall - too high for us to reach - and they sent someone up quickly to take care of it! The other travelers that we saw were all business and older (age 30 +). The parking fee of $5/night (underground) was the best value that we found. Location was convenient for the airport, Balboa Park & zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Agree..San Diego's little secret”
Reviews.Author: sissybabe
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. Spent three days in San Diego and stayed here all three nights. Rooms spacious, clean and comfortable. Room overlooked the bay. Other rooms overlooked the marina so not a bad room in the place for spectacular views. We enjoyed the breakfast each morning. Staff very quick to keep plates cleared away on tables and keep your cups full. Cooks made sure the serving dishes were kept full with hot fresh food. Loved the evening reception with half off drinks and appetizers. Bar tender JOHN was great. Been there 12 years and I know why it's a great place to be. If you go you must try the fried Calamari..mouth watering good!!! Loved walking along the bay every morning and each night. Can't wait to go back and will most definately stay here, no reason not to was GREAT!!!! Didn't find any other hotel while visiting I'd rather stay at.

Reviews.Title: “It's Simple And Does The Job”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingAussie
Reviews.Content: Be a little wary of which room you get as the walls seem a bit thin and we spent our first night awake due to stomping above us then were pleasantly woken by the cleaners and vaccuming at 5.20am The second night was better, but spend a few extra dollars in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pattyk1043
Reviews.Content: Just returned from first trip to San Diego and stayed at Bay Club Hotel & Marina on Shelter Island. Can't say enough good things. Location, location. Had considered further up north but was so glad we landed here. Just 10-20 minutes from all sites we wanted to visit. Walking distance to bay. Quiet, clean & spotless room. We had a room on 2nd floor overlooking the Marina. Staff were so helpful and suggested routes to take to see the sites. ALWAYS a smile. Even suggested we return our rental the night before leaving and they transported us early the next morning. The included breakfast was a plus and got us off to a good start each day. Restaurant staff outstanding, even remembered I liked green tea and not coffee. Room always clean when we returned. Would recommend anyone going to try this hotel. So personal compared to chain hotels. Parking was less than all others too.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: joni467
Reviews.Content: We just completed our 5th stay at this property over the Thanksgiving Holiday. We are never disappointed. I can't say enough good things about this hotel but I'll share a few: CLEAN and updated, great FULL breakfasts (eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, pancakes or waffles, and fresh fruit, juice and coffee); convenient restaurant (great menu and quality food too) on site for those evenings you just want to stay in; unlike Hotel Circle, this area provides miles of walking trails along the Bay in Shelter Island Park; great location within the City, close to downtown and other attractions; coastal location with great views of the City or the Marina; great value for the $$; and we love the staff many of whom have been with them for several years. Our daughter and her 8 month old baby joined us on this last trip and it worked out perfectly. The room was large enough for 3 adults and the accessories a baby requires.

Reviews.Title: “Many times visitor.”
Reviews.Author: nolina40
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Bay Club for over ten (10) years during our frequent visits to San Diego. The help is ALWAYS friendly and helpful. The rooms are spotless and the breakfasts will satisfy any appetite. Our favorite rooms are on the second floor and overlook the Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Redbear21
Reviews.Content: Quite impressive with the property. I was a little apprehensive to book with them when I read about the views that boast to be of good quality, but it definitely stands by all the comments. We were on the second floor and originally had the view of the Bay, but switched to the Marina side since the night lights were more spectular. The swimming pool/spa and resturant are located on the Marina...awesome view a night. It was clean and cozy. The buffet was delicious and not skimpy and the staff members are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Great”
Reviews.Author: Couchking
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights last week. Everything was great. Had a beautiful view of the harbor. The bathrooms do need a makeover. The staff was very friendly. I don't understand how people say the breakfast was not good. For FREE, I thought it was better than some I pay for. Great value for the $$.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: alklontz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to San Diego for his birthday. I chose this hotel based on the reviews on here. I am so very glad I did so. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our room was much larger than I anticipated. We had a 1st floor room with a view of the marina. I read that the marina balconies were larger than the bay side balconies. We were quite impressed with the size of the balcony. It was extremely quiet all of the times that we were outside. Aside from a few people walking to and from their boats, there wasn't much else noise-wise. The first night, we called the front desk to request some firm pillows (what my boyfriend prefers). We were told that they would look for some and asked how many we needed. About 5 minutes later, a knock at the door, and they are being delivered! This truely made our night and helped him sleep so much more comfortably. The breakfast was wonderful. We loved the variety available each morning. It is so nice to be able to have a hot breakfast instead of being limited to pastries, toast, and cereals in the mornings, such as at other hotels. We found the servers in the dining room to be very attentive, quickly offering us coffee as we were sitting down, clearing our plates as needed, and offering refills on OJ. On our second night, the wine, cheese plate, and chocolate covered strawberries I'd requested during the reservation, were in the room waiting for us when we returned from dinner. I would highly recommend all of these items. Overall, it was the perfect get away for us. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PatdaRat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and went to the Packet game. Could not have been more pleased. Rooms were nice and clean. Food was good. Free breakfast was great. The staff is friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good location and views but hotel only average”
Reviews.Author: GeoffO869
Reviews.Content: We chose the Bay Club largely due to its room rate location and also because of the pretty favourable reviews posted on Tripadvisor. It was easy to find and the position on Shelter Island was very nice indeed - with views over to Coronado from one side of the property and of the marina on the other. However for some reason our three night stay was something of a disappointment and didn't really live up to our expectations. Maybe it had something to do with the lack of attention to detail. The staff were friendly enough - but too often they seemed to simply be going through the motions. Both when we had dinner on our first night and at breakfast on all three mornings there was no real sign of them wanting to impress or going the extra mile. We noticed there was a lot of standing around and chatting - rather than being proactive and anticipating customer needs. We often had to ask for something - then they forgot about it and never sounded overly bothered when we had to ask for a second time. The food at dinner was good but we didn't particularly rate the included breakfast buffet - especially the hot items which didn't really look that appetising. Perhaps it was our fault for coming down to breakfast within the last hour of service - but that shouldn't make any difference. The food should be appetising whatever the service time and maybe it would have been better had it been cooked little and often. Sadly the majority looked like it had been lying around for quite some time - and the cold display was quite sparse and certainly nothing to get excited about. Our room had a marina view from the second floor and was large and quite well equipped. However it didn't smell overly fresh and both the decor and the fixtures and fittings could have done with a bit of TLC - as indeed could many of the public areas for that matter. We also felt that the $5 daily parking fee was rather unnecessary. Presumably this is simply a method of raising additional revenue rather than controlling parking spaces - since the hotel has both a large surface and underground car park and there is also ample free parking directly outside. There is a music venue next door which holds numerous live shows - but this didn't bother us at all and it was all quiet by 11pm. Sadly I don't think we would return to the Bay Club unless there was a general smartening up throughout and maybe a change in how it is run with much more attention to detail. We are also left wondering how it scores as highly as it does within the San Diego area which has so many hotels from which to choose.

Reviews.Title: “JJ from P.A”
Reviews.Author: nyfd266
Reviews.Content: This was a five star place in southern cal.If you are visiting family in the service the location is the best.We had a room that faced the Marina and the view was good. We asked to have a last minute party for 15 people and they exceeded in every way to make it great. The staff couldn,t do enough to help you. The place is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Service, Outstanding Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin H
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club exceeded all of our expectations. The customer service was exceptional, the rooms large, bright and clean. The location was absolutely perfect, both in proximity to attractions and good places to eat, as well as the beauty of Shelter Island. The breakfast buffet was so nice and convenient, and tasted great! I give them 5 stars on this review, however I do have one suggestion for improvement....the bed was too soft and felt as though it had perhaps seen much, much better days. Still, it did not detract from the outstanding experience we had. I'd been looking forward to our trip to San Diego for years, and it was everything I'd hoped for....we will be coming back on a regular basis, and will definitely be staying at the Bay Club each time!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler4248
Reviews.Content: We visited the Bay Club Hotel again last week and enjoyed it as much as the first time. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was quite varied with hot and cold selections. The room was comfortable, clean and well stocked. There is a $5.00 parking fee which is well worth it. There is plenty of parking next to the entrance and below with an elevator to both floors above. The hotel is on Shelter Island with a nice walking park in front along the San Diego Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: swesterfer
Reviews.Content: Rented two rooms for three nights and they were both nice clean rooms with spectacular views of the Bay. The staff were really friendly and accomodating. The full breakfast buffet was a real treat, much better than the buffet at previous hotel on same trip. Short drive to the attractions such as Sea World and Zoo. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends and will stay there again when next visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - will return”
Reviews.Author: Sitko
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant, friendly hotel with excellent service. Room was clean, quiet (facing the marina, not the bay) and functional. Full breakfast was included and was much better than most 'breakfast included deals', with excellent service. The front desk was most helpful and provided us with pick-up and drop off at airport and several other locations during our 4 night stay. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is a very comfortable place and a good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Bay Club!”
Reviews.Author: SheilaLC
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful service and very comfortable rooms with views of the marina and yacht club. Delicious breakfast buffet is included with the room! Our family has been staying in this hotel for several years. Anyone giving this place a bad review is just too hard to please! We only have great memories!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: PASANDYBAY
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe that this place dropped down in the ratings. I read the previous review and couldn't believe it. I was just there and this place is great!!! The room was large, very clean and we had a beautiful view of the marina. NO BED BUGS!!! Very Clean!!! We liked having the bath tub and toilet, separate from the sink & counter so that 2 people could get dressed at the same time. The staff was just great -- the friendliest and the most willing to help. We asked for a recommendation for an Italian restaurant and Amanda not only recommended one for us but took us over and picked us up afterwards. We had borrowed a friend's car and had some problems with it and Patrick came out to help us. We sat on our balcony and listened to the concert that was held next door. We loved John, the bartender, and the Happy Hour they have there. Our appetizers were great. I had the Chicken Quesadillos and my friend had the Ahi Tuna one night. Both were delicious. We had so much fun at the bar, that we didn't go out for dinner. The breakfast was very nice. The only thing that I could possibly complain about was that the bar was not big enough -- only an 8 seater. Although, they do have high top tables and a fireplace there. Also, there is no microwave in the room. We would not stay at any other place when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: NicolaandMark
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2 night stay at the hotel to end our 3 week holiday in America and to celebrate my Birthday, the staff was very pleasant, the room was a great size, lovely and clean and the view over the Marina was amazing, also the complimentary breakfast was fab, anyone being put off by the pictures of the hotel looking dated, don't be, it's not the most modern hotel you will go to but it is clean, tidy, friendly, with a great pool area and lovely views and for a really good price, we would defiantly stay again and recommend it. Nicola and Mark. England. October 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs?”
Reviews.Author: bearcatMark
Reviews.Content: Got in around midnight and went to the room. Pulled down the sheets and there were bugs (and droppings) in the bed. Wife set something down on the wicker side table, and the vibration made a bunch bugs scamper around for a second from under the lamp and stuff and then disappear again. We looked up the bugs and droppings on the internet and it very clearly appeared to be bed bugs. The markings on the bed in particular were clear, and seemed to be bed bug droppings. Went down and requested another room. After a while they put us in another room that stunk like RAID, like it had just been sprayed with bug killer. We didn't see any bugs so we spent the night. Woke up in the morning and there were a few bugs in the bed larger than the bugs the night before. Looked those up and they appeared to be the adult variety of beg bugs (the ones the night before appeared not to be adults yet). Obviously, got the hell out of that hotel. It isn't very nice either..run down, looks like it hasn't been redecorated since the 70s. Even a 5-star resort can get bed bugs...you can't control who comes into your hotel and what they bring. The most disappointing thing was how it was handled. The woman at the desk acted like she didn't believe us. She sent a security man up who verified it in the first room--he saw the bugs with his own eyes. But this time we didn't see the bugs in the second room--the room where we slept. When we got back downstairs, she was sarcastic and sort of suggesting we were lying and would say, "Oh, that's strange that they are in the first room, and they just also happened to be in the 2nd room you say? What a strange coincidence that out of all the rooms, they're only in the 2 you stayed in, especially since the security guy didn't see any in the second room." I mean, they admitted there were bugs in the first room, but instead of an apology, we get treated like we're lying about the 2nd room. No discount, no apology, just treated like we're liars and don't let the door hit you on the way out. (In fairness, the rest of the workers there were nice, and I had to attend events there the rest of the weekend, and everyone was nice and professional. Just didn't like being treated that way by the woman on duty that night---she kept a sweater over her nametag so I didn't get her name). They knew we moved to a hotel next door (Half Moon--very nice), so we got a voicemail from the manager the next day at our new hotel explaining that they checked it out and it was just fleas. JUST fleas!!! First of all, they weren't fleas in my opinion-fleas jump and look different. In our opinion these were bed bugs. But it's strange to call up, "Oh, by the way, no big deal, they're just fleas." In other words, we're a flea-bag hotel rather than a bed-bug hotel. No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cudagirl69
Reviews.Content: Great place. Views are wonderful, rooms are comfortable and good sized,and staff is wonderful. Staff treats you great and are so helpful for anything you might need. Rooms are clean and ours overlooked the marina and the view went on forever. I will stay here again the next time we go to San Diego. Breakfast was free and it was great. If you walked away hungry it was your fault. Parking was good and having the beach and walk way right across the street was nice. There are so many different ships in the bay and the view is great. LOVED this place.You won't be disappointed if you stay here. Location is close to so many of the sights in town and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of San Diego Bay and a full-breakfast included!”
Reviews.Author: NockieT
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club is located in a quiet area -- Shelter Island -- and near some wonderful restaurants. The restaurant at the Bay Club also serves good food and we have had family dinners there in the past. The hotel rooms are large with comfortable beds. A scrumptious full buffet breakfast is included, which we ate at a poolside table. This was my second stay at the hotel, and for both stays we were given a second floor room with a view of San Diego Bay which we could enjoy from our private balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overpriced and outdated”
Reviews.Author: lupus81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bay Club Hotel & Marina for 3 nights during August 2011. I shared a 2 queen double with 2 friends. The location is great, nice view of the San Diego Bay and no noise of landing jets on Coronada Island at all. The Room was spacious and even had a balcony. BUT the Hotel is really outdated and definitely needs some refurbishments! We even changed the room after our first night, because the room smelled badly (Yes, it was a non-smoking Room). The breakfast was super basic and not worth the money at all. Given the relatively high price I wouldn't stay at this place again. Rather I would look for accommodation directly at Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Too good to stay away”
Reviews.Author: sandyalice
Reviews.Content: We love everything about the Bay Club. Smaller size, nice restraunt, outstanding location, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: euanp1
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 week trip to Southern California. Spent the last 2 nights in this hotel. My only criticism would be that we were given a partial view room when we had booked and paid for a bay view room with the explanation that rooms with views were for people who did not book on line!! An 'upgrade' was available at an additional charge. The room we were given was very dark. A call to the on-line travel agent sorted out the room and we ended up in a nice bright room with a great view of the bay. The location is excellent, the room was clean and comfortable. Would stay again, provided I get the right room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Marina View....”
Reviews.Author: pamelaNewportBeach
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here on October 18, 2011 for 1 night. We had a room with a marina view. Loved the view.....the room was comfortable. and clean. We booked the dinner package and were very pleased the food and the service. The hotel staff were very nice. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ian I
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, always said hi and was willing to help us with whatever we needed. Location couldn't have been better! Everything was 10 minutes away or less. Views of bay were great and a nice 2 mintue walk to the sand was a nice lil addition. Hotel was a lil dated but who cares if you don't live there. Beds worked, bathroom worked, shower worked and the great views worked so who cares. More than enough parking, always got a spot where I wanted! Hotel next door looked like they always had so much foot and car traffic with random stuff they were having and was worried it might flood over to our hotel but they did a good job of keeping it away and our hotel peaceful. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunrise or Sunset; Harborside or Oceanside”
Reviews.Author: qtparties
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Shelter Island close to San Diego, but not that close. We took a taxi one night to the city for dinner and it cost us $25 one way. However, the hotel offers free shuttle services to major transportation areas, like the bus Station, Harbor side for Cruise departing and the airport. We got free hot breakfast every morning. The rooms were nice. San Diego was great! So much to do there. This location is kind of out of the way for city sight seeing, but you can take the hotel shuttle van to the harbor and buy a trolley ticket that stops all around the city. That was great, and no taxi fees! The night life is cool in the city. We went to the Gas Lamp Quarters area and ate outside at Jimmy Loves. Delish! Reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “We would return”
Reviews.Author: racer182
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the 1 Oct 2011 for 10 days. The location could not be bettered. Although it is close to the airport the planes never caused us any noise problems. To be honest with the airport in the very centre of the city every hotel is going to be close to the airport, many could be right under the flight path but this is not. I can see a comment from another reviewer who said that the staff are not friendly. Yes we did have to make an effort to speak to them but as soon as you do they are very friendly and helpful. John in the bar was good fun. I think this is better than staff who are over friendly and in your face all the time. Breakfast was included, but was the same almost every day. A self service buffet comprised of a selection from 3 cereals, hot food was choice of scrambled egg, bacon, breakfast potatoes and some kind of waffle, toast, orange juice and tea or coffee. It was a good start to the day but a little boring. The dining room had good views over the marina and you could sit outside near the pool to have breakfast if you wished. With most hotels charging a fortune for breakfast we found this a good way to save a little money. Our room ( number 142) was on the ground floor. The hotel is only 2 or maybe 3 floors and I would recommend that you take a room on the upper floor, not only for the great views over the marina or sea front road (if you take that side of the hotel) but also we had a family above us for a couple of days who allowed their kids to stomp around the room and the noise was terrible for those two days. The room was spacious and well equipped, including a fridge to store your own drinks etc. There were loads of TV channels to choose from including sports channels, all on a giant LCD TV. The bathroom had a small bath with shower over. Only problems we had in the room were, the air con was old fashioned and although it worked it was very noisy so could not be left on overnight so the room did get very hot, also there were ants. We left a cake that we had bought from Town out, sealed in its box overnight on the top of the chest of drawers and in the morning it was covered with ants who were taking the cake apart and carrying it away down the legs of the chest and disappearing under the floor. There was a free to use computer for internet in the lobby, which was useful for checking flights etc or getting more details of the area. $5 a day for parking is a lot less than most other hotels in the area and when you take into account the cost of the staying at this hotel and that breakfast is included we thought it OK. Altogether we thought the hotel good value and would stay there again. Just a few notes on San Diego, you need to hire a car, do not visit Sea World especially if you have been to the one in Florida as its very poor and very expensive to get in. Do visit Point Loma for the views. I hope you found this review of some help.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Pamela A
Reviews.Content: I had both my wedding and wedding reception at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina this past weekend (Oct 7-9) and could not have been more pleased with how the entire affair turned out. Most of my guests came in from out of town so we had them all stay at the hotel. It was a great decision because they all enjoyed themselves and had wonderful things to say about the hotel. Everyone loved being so close to everything (downtown San Diego, the San Diego Zoo, Sea World) and they loved their rooms. They had incredible views from both sides of the hotel and received great service from the hotel staff. We had wonderful weather that weekend so many of them got a chance to relax by the beautiful pool and patio in the back of the hotel. They all raved about the food and the wonderful (complimentary) breakfast buffet each morning. As for my wedding and reception I worked with Tammy Garbini, Director of Sales and Marketing and she took care of everything right down to the last detail. We decided to have the ceremony outside on the back patio which was absolutely gorgeous against the incredible views of the marina. As luck would have it the weather was spectacular so we truly got married in paradise! After the wedding Tammy arranged for a nice cocktail hour so our guests could mingle and enjoy drinks and hor d'oeuvres. It was the perfect touch to lead into the reception. The food at our wedding reception was delicious and the service from the hotel staff was fantastic. They took great care of not just our bridal party but every single one of our guests. Absolutely everyone felt attended to and it gave such a warm and personal feeling to the entire affair. I didn't have to worry about a thing - Tammy and her incredible staff handled everything for me so I could enjoy my day and spend every minute with my guests. We absolutely loved it and had a wonderful time! The next time I have a big party to do I won't hestitate to have it at the Bay Club and Marina. Or even a nice weekend with friends â€¦ We had a great experience and are looking forward to going back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelor146
Reviews.Content: When we showed up for our reservation we were so surprised to find an awesome place. Fantastic view, we had the harbor, great restaurant etc. Our next stop was to be the del Coronado and we even tried to cancel those reservations to stay here longer. Great deals available on line too. The fun part was sitting outside at night and listening to the bands playing next door.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Bay Club & Marina it was perfect for us!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrskeystone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights Oct. 6Th-10Th. Check in was very smooth, Amanda was very nice and helpful with us at check in. We had a nice room on the second floor with a view of the Marina that is what I booked online since others said it was a nice view and I would have to agree it was so nice sitting out on the fairly large balcony and watching all the boats and sailboats coming and going. The rooms are large, we had a nice comfy king bed and loved the sheets soooo soft! Had a small frig and small coffee maker, a microwave would have been nice to have too. They had a really nice TV with a great picture. They have a comp. breakfast in the morning it was pretty good everyday it was the same eggs, bacon,sausage, either pancakes or french toast and some fried potatoes along with toast and cereals fresh fruit etc. I know some others who have stayed here have complained about the ticket they give you at breakfast for a tip. Well, they claim it's just so they know you are staying at the hotel you have to write down your room number. I have no problem with leaving a tip as a matter of fact I do at every place I stay at that has a comp. breakfast I just leave a few dollars I mean come on people these people run around trying to make you happy and bringing you coffee clearing your dirty plates and you can't leave them a few dollars for that? Tell me where you could feed a few of you for a few bucks and a full breakfast like they have?! This as you can see annoys me that some people are so darn cheap! So, anyway I liked the location to the hotel it was easy to get into downtown, gaslamp district, SeaWorld was close by and Old Town too. I knew the hotel was old as are most of the places in San Diego but it was fine I liked the Hawaiian decor and everything was fine not broken or torn everything worked just fine so I have no complaints at all. Their web-site is pretty much spot on so check it out if it's not for you go elsewhere. I would definately stay there again when I'm in San Diego I thought it was great had a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to view the harbor or marina, very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: bootleg711
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times, at 2 different times of year. High and low season (August and January). Rooms in August were expensive (210/nite), but this was in 2007, whereas in January 2011 we got 99/nite. Regardless, we will never stay anywhere else in San Diego. The Bay Club is convenient to everything San Diego has to offer, In N Out Burger, the Zoo, Cabrillo, and the 5 Freeway. It's even close to the airport without being annoying. I also find being across from NAS Coronado Island a treat because we are greeting by Blackhawks and Aircraft Carriers on a daily basis! The Breakfast buffet is great, the staff is tremendous and changed our room the first time we were there in 2007 to satisfy my wife. Overall, we can't wait for our next trip to San Diego, and we'll staying at the Bay Club for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice view - but old”
Reviews.Author: jazzinj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, the night before we were heading home after a week's stay in Oceanside. We wanted to be closer to the airport, and also wanted to try out a new location in San Diego. I booked the Hawaiian package - I can't remember exactly what it was called, but it included two free drinks in the lounge, and a welcome platter of fruit and cookies, and parking was also included in the price. We didn't get the free drinks because the lounge closed early and we didn't make it in time. The platter was delivered just as we were heading to the room after check-in, by the same lady that checked us in. Check in service was excellent, the lady was very friendly and welcoming. The room was clean and bright, but smelled kind of old and musty. It was pretty old, old carpets, old carpets in the hallway, had the wood 70's look to it. There is a small bar area with a fridge and counter and sink, where the coffee maker is. The bathroom was clean and functional, but lighting was quite dim, the fan made a lot of noise, and again it was pretty old. We had a room with two queen beds. The view from the balcony was very nice, you can see the water (we had a bay view), the patio window was old and rickety, and the balcony was also old. We parked outside just below our balcony (we were on the second floor). It did look and feel like a Polynesian theme, it reminded me of the old apartment time share units in Waikiki, same era (only well kept compared to the ones in Waikiki). The lady at the front desk recommended a restaurant nearby, she said it was a 20 minute walk but it certainly was not, we walked 20 minutes and were in the middle of nowhere, then decided to go back and get the car - it was definitely a short drive, though. The surrounding area was very nice, we went for a walk along the path by the water, walked onto a pier where a few people were fishing, played in the playground nearby, watched some birds. It's a beautiful, relaxing area - not much around other than that, though. It's definitely a marina place, you drive through a lot of boat related businesses before you get to the hotels by the water. The walls are thin - there was a baby crying in the next room and it kept me up until late and then woke me up early in the morning. Luckily my kids and husband are heavy sleepers and manage to sleep right through it. I'm not a light sleeper, either, but it woke me up. We went down to the free breakfast, and yes, there are hot choices, and we did manage to eat something, but it wasn't very good. I had to ask for a coffee refill a few times before I got one. The servers looked rushed and harried even though it was a buffet and "seat yourself" style service. They still had to clear the tables and serve drinks. Overall I would say it was a pleasant stay, I wasn't expecting the Hilton or anything like that, so it met my expectations - I would suggest they upgrade the place a bit, though. It was fine for a one night stay, I probably wouldn't spend the week there, and I would probably not stay there again - now that we've tried the Shelter Island area, it's nice, but there's not much around, there are better locations to stay as a home base in San Diego. If I were to stay in that area again, I'd probably try the other, newer hotels nearby. It was okay value for what I paid, I think that I could have found a nicer place cheaper but it was probably more costly due to its proximity to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KimD2009
Reviews.Content: We (My husband 2 teenage sons and I) recently stayed at the Bay Club for 3 nights while visiting San Diego. We had a Marina View room which had a great view over the marina. The room was clean and comfortable and a good size. Breakfast was included in the rate and comprised juice, cereal, hot food and tea and coffee. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night and the food and service were fine. The hotel was about 10 mins drive from SeaWorld and about 15mins from the zoo. It was also close to Point Loma lookout and about a 20 min drive round to Coronado. Check in was easy and the reception staff pleasant. The only minor -ve was morning breakfasts where the same waitress every morning seemed to be on a timer to clear plates, reset tables fairly haphazardly and generally looked like working there was a chore for her. Other than that it was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: blondieanddagwood
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Bay Club...the decor and location on beautiful Shelter Island made it feel like a tropical getaway. The full complimentary breakfast was great. The room was very big and clean, overall nice, but a room remodel is needed; I'd venture a guess that this is being planned for the near future. The only complaint I have is mold around the rim of the tub, which can be easily remedied with a little Clorox (room 102, Bay Club staff!) :) Staff was friendly and sympathetic when we reported the constant stomping of the guests who were staying in the room above us (not much they could do...). We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “More sympathetic choices in the area”
Reviews.Author: D D
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my nanny and son so my wife and I could relax at a near by hotel (Kona Kai resort) and still be near our 13 month old. It would have been our first trip together since the birth of our son but unfortunately he came down with a sudden stomach virus that caused us to be unable to make the trip. I called the bay club to cancel my reservations over 24 hours in advance but unfortunately they could not do anything for us and i was charged for a nights rate. Our reservation at nearby Kona Kai was happily cancelled with a very caring and sympathetic woman wishing my son a speedy recovery. Long story short, we made the trip the following weekend and the entire family stayed at Kona Kai, great place and GREAT customer service! Bay club, not so much. I understand policy but come on, exceptions can be made sometimes right?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: RPonech
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Bay Club, location is fantastic right across the street from the bay. This was our first trip to Shelter Island and we really loved the location. Our room was very large, nothing fancy but very clean and with a small deck which overlooked the bay.
