There was a good selection of fresh fruit, cereal and pastries. I've had plenty of mediocre free breakfast offerings so this was a very pleasant perk. We did eat dinner at the restaurant and found the food to be good but a bit expensive. The best thing was the house salad from the room service menu. It's a wonderful plate of fresh greens, apple and mandarin orange slices, etc. with a delicious house vinaigrette. Room service was timely. The staff was professional yet friendly. It's a small hotel so they get to know who you are. The location is very good. Close to everything, including a Von's and Trader Joe's nearby on Rosecrans. They do charge for parking. This seems odd as it's not like public transportation is an option. Liked the free wireless access in the room and having the mini-fridge was convenient. All in all, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a bit dated with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: calgary972
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. We chose this hotel because it was one of the rare ***hotels offering complimentary breakfast not too far from downtown. Breakfast on the 1st day was good but by day 3, we realized that the same dishes were served every morning. The good points are the beautiful views, the close beach (especially at night), the cheap parking ($5), free wi-fi. The bad points are the dated look and smell of the hotel, the walking distance from the shops (if you do not have a car, it is not that close). We did use public transport (it took us an hour from our room to downtown). Basically, if you want to stay in San Diego for more than 3 nights, it is better to go for a good hotel in the downtown (4 stars deals, with a microwave, buy food for breakfast especially if you have children), rent a car for a day or 2 (parking is expensive) and buy a day pass to use public transport. The best beaches are on Coronado Island (there are ferries from downtown or you can drive. Parking is free). Restaurants to try are Tin Fish (not far from the convention centre. Avoid going during lunchtime but great value and quality for money, try rice instead of fries). Tender greens (2400 Historic Decatur Road, not far from the airport) quality fresh organic food!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: LuvSWA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel recommended by friends. Two floors; view of bay and city on one side, or marina on the other. We stayed in a bay-view room; next time I'd try the marina view. In either case I'd ask for a second-floor room. There's a walk along the bay within steps of the hotel. Includes breakfast buffet with lots of choices; we also ate a satisfying dinner here one night. Servers were pleasant and accommodating. Located very close to SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: mikeandaimie
Reviews.Content: Our first room smelled like mildew so the staff kindly moved us to a new room. The rooms they moved us to were better but still dirty and a little musty smelling. W also had both a roach and something that looked like a centipede in our room. The dinner menu in the resaurant was pretty overpriced and the bartender acted like he was doing me a huge personal favor every time I asked him a question. The rooms are hugely overpriced for what you get. The front desk staff and the servers at breakfast were great and the location is pretty good. The security did respond right away to my complaint that the people next door were partying loudly past midnight. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: MikeC91
Reviews.Content: Reserved here based on TripAdvisor recommendations, and boy am I glad I did. While the decor could use an upgrade and the service in the dining room was slow our last night there, everything else about the place was wonderful. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. From the hotel, Seaworld and the Zoo are a stone's throw away, and the shuttle to the airport is quick and easy. The atmosphere is relaxed, and the water is all around you. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great service, but needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Sjefen
Reviews.Content: The service was great, and that was the best thing, oh-...and the rooms are huge, which is nice when you're travelling with heaps of luggage. The rooms and the hotel looks dated, and could use some new carpets etc.. you have to pay for parking, not good. The location is not at all good if you are going to experience San Diego, you need a car or a taxi to take you to the Gas Lamp District and other areas for dining and such. the breakfast is inckluded, but its really bad, not much to choose from. Next time I would stay in the city

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, busy location”
Reviews.Author: 50statetraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tightly placed between a nightclub hotel spot, another hotel, a packed marina, and the Bay. While the rooms are clean and adequate, the carpeting and sofas in the lobby/halls need to be replaced. The steady noise from the activity of helicopters and military ships in the Bay, along with the airport traffic and the adjacent nightclub's outside concerts makes sleeping and rest a bit challenging. The balconies are teeny, the air-conditioning units noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Staff”
Reviews.Author: rhionsnana
Reviews.Content: We were there 7/9/10-7/17/10 & were very impressed with the quality of both the hotel & the staff. From the moment we checked in to the time we checked out I cannot say enough about how well we were treated. Many Staff members would greet us by name as we were coming & going. I would like to give special notice to Brandi & John in the Bar area. They both really know how to make a guest feel at home. Both of them are true gems. I would also like to recognize Jody & Patrick at the front desk. One evening we wanted to go to Bali Hai for dinner. We did not want to walk or drive as we knew we were going to have a Mai Tai, so we called down for a cab. Upon finding out where we were going, Jody offered us the use of the shuttle service. That is what I call great customer relations! Patrick, both at check in & check out was most helpful. All in all, whomever does the hiring for this hotel does a great job. We will make this out San Diego home! Tom & Nancy, Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: rnsmpq
Reviews.Content: Nice comfy hotel. Staff very friendly. Clean rooms. Love the empty mini refrigerator tin the room. Did not have to worry being charge for drinks we never took. Free internet and reasonable parking fee. Would return!

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and comfortable place to stay,great service.”
Reviews.Author: CheshireRelaxed
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for a few years and we have always had great service, many of the staff have been here since we started coming. we have family in california and like to stay at the Bay View at the end of our holiday before we fly back to the UK. Our Grandchildren like to stay here, the pool is perfect for them.Its such a family friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “spoilt our relaxing time there”
Reviews.Author: mackamelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at bay club for 5 days and had a terrible experience with the security at the hotel. There was a party in the next room and the music was very loud. When I called reception to complain they sent the security man to break the party up. This was at 11pm. Twenty minutes later the music started again and when I called reception they told me that everyone had vacated the room. I told them that they had to come up again as there sounded as if there were 40 people in the room. He did come up and there were that many people in the room. They also tried to come through the conecting door into our room which made us very frightened. When I opened my door to tell the security man that they tried to get through to us he yelled at me to get back into my room or I would be in trouble. I think he was embarressed that he had not dealt with the problem. Half an hour later it all stared again as they were sneaking in from other entrances and they still had the key. That was the last straw, I called reception and asked for the police to be called which they did and when they arrived to get the remainder out they asked why they had not been called before. It took till 3am to fix the problem. The reason I am writting this long review is that they have to fix their security as 40 people could gain access to a hotel room without the front desk aware of what was going on. I have to say that Timothy Brogan front desk manager was very good as he moved us to another room and gave us a dinner on the house and deducted the fee for that night. He said the general manager would be in touch to discuss what had happened but he did not. I hope the Bay club marina will learn from this and step up their security. Otherwise it is a lovely location and hopefully no one else will have to go through what we endured for over 4 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: MidAtlanticMike
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, beautiful,great value

Reviews.Title: “Spent 29th Anniversary at Bay Club”
Reviews.Author: RA8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a 2 day/ 1 night visit to celebrate our 29th anniversary. After calling all 4 resorts on Shelter Island we chose the Bay Club Resort and Marina. Wow! A one bedroom suite with great views of Downtown San Diego, the bay and channel. The management said they were " softies " for anniversaries. So they gave us an upgrade. They drove us to the Bali Hai restaurant ( Best Mai Tai's anywhere) and offered to pick us up too. Nice firm king size bed wonderful pillows. Two HD TV's. Recently refurbished rooms looked better than many 1 bedroom apt's I've lived in. Full buffet breakfast and a walk along the bay and channel the next morning. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain and Central Location to family attractions.”
Reviews.Author: mikeyboy_esq
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the favorable reviews on Trip Advisor. My 2 night stay at this hotel was 100% consistant with those favorable Trip Advisor reviews. The room we had included a balcony overlooking the marina (nice view) and the hotel staff were exceptionally friendly/helpful. The price included a tasty breakfast and I thought it was a good bargain compared to other hotels that I saw when searching for a hotel. My advice is to skip the local restaurants up the street...the ones we tried were not that good. Other than the local restaurants, I liked everything about my stay including the location...which was an easy drive to San Diego Zoo, Coronado Beach, Belmont Park and other popular attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: momof2nwifey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Club and it was very nice. My husband and I decided short notice we wanted to go for a romantic getaway. It was perfect we saw a deal on their website for a night and dinner for 2 it was great. We were kind of on a budget and we stayed recieved free steak and shrimp dinner plus breakfast buffet in the morning it is right across from the water so we walked on the shore the whole evening what more could you ask for? I would recommend this to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: duckiekishes
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great. The hotel has more of a laid back feel. We had a marina view room with balcony. The view was beautiful and so peaceful. They had plenty of parking (underground parking as well that we did not find out about until mid stay which made things much more convenient for us!) Parking was $5 at night but still not bad. The hotel was close to many attractions and in a great area. They have many surrounding restaurants that were very good though I did not really prefer the dinner selection at the hotel restaurant and I was disappointed that they do not have microwaves in the rooms as there are mini fridges. They provided breakfast and had a great assortment. Breads, fruits, eggs, hashbrowns, etc. They provided free wifi. Kids loved the pool and hot tub. Thought there was much noise outside at times due to concerts and such we could not hear a sound when our balcony door was closed. All of the employees were very friendly and helpful. All in all...great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: scubal0ver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Club for 6 nights for a near by family wedding. The Bay Club in on Shelter Island in San Diego, directly opposite the Naval Air station North Island (about 1 km away over the water). The Hotel fronts the harbour, and backs onto a huge marina filed with what is literally a forest of yacht masts. Logically, the views from the back are not stunning. From the front ( if you are a military plane buff as I am, or enjoy occasional military traffic) it can be quite fascinating. The good news is that the Military are GOOD neighbours, and the F18s usually don't start flying much before 9am. ( For this Australian, seeing 20 + parked F18s, a similar number of Sea Hawk helicopters - in both cases representing a large percentage of our whole air force- and the VERY regular naval patrols in the harbour was a real eye opener). The Bay Club is 2 storied, it has a good pool, and the restaurant & bar are quite adequate. The included breakfast was OK, lots of it, but a narrow selection, and the food was often only warm. Lunch off the menu was better, certainly well priced, tasty and with good service. We found a room service dinner the same. The rooms were of good size, fairly quiet, and the bed comfortable. Both the TV channel selection and the free WiFi were good. Personally, I hated the pillows (I have a long term dodgy neck, and it didn't respond well to the supplied unsupportive and lumpy pillows). The room was always hot and stuffy (unless you opened the verandah door which let the flies in), and the air conditioning proved a bit aggressive when we used it to combat the heat, making sleep a bit harder than it could have been. The room itself was a little tired, and the terylene curtaining by the verandah door was shredded in a couple of places. So, while not perfect, well priced, great location, and somewhere I would be happy to stay again - but I'll bring my own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneKaren67
Reviews.Content: We were quite impressed with the Bay Club & Marina Hotel. It is an older hotel but quite well maintained. Our room on ground floor was very roomy with a small balcony. Room was cleaned to a good standard. Pool & spa area overlooking the Marina was great. We also got to listen to an outdoor concert by Roger Daltrey being played at the venue next door which was a bonus! The breakfast was quite adequate with both hot/cold selections (we only had the cold). We also used the small gym which had weights machine, treadmills etc. We also made use of the laundry with coin operated machines. The area around the hotel is great for a nice walk along the waterfront. The possible only gripe I would have is that the hotel do charge US5 for 30mins to use their internet terminal. I think they have free wifi but I didnt want to lug my laptop around for 5 weeks. They also charge for parking - US5 which was reasonable. On our next visit to San Diego we would definately stay there again. We had a great Thai meal at Royal Thai Restaurant in the GasLamp area. The prices were extremely reasonable & the food was great (cant remember the street name but it was one of the main streets on a corner).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great view, terrible wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: bearcatuc
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms, one with a King and the other with 2 double beds both with a harbor view. The view was awesome. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, always there to give us advice for great places to eat and print out directions for all our destinations. The breakfast is wonderful, much better then most free breakfast buffets. My only complaint is that the free wireless internet didn't work in either of our rooms. They even gave us a booster to try, but that didn't help. Having internet access is very important to our family (all 4 of us brought our laptops) and not having internet access during our stay at this hotel was a bummer. If having the internet in your hotel room is important, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. We stayed in 6 different hotels during our 2 week visit out west, and this hotel was the only one with terrible internet access (and the hotel we paid the most to stay in).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a beautiful location.”
Reviews.Author: Russellicious
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night this past week with my girlfriend. It`s a super clean hotel modeled and furnished in a 1970`s type of setting that works in a super cool way. The location & scenery are top notch. The complimentary breakfast buffet was average. Regular oatleal instead of packaged instant would go a long way to improving it if I have to nit pick. I`ll definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine Elegance at Bargain Prices!”
Reviews.Author: surfergrrl10
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club Hotel & Marina San Diego was one of the best hotels my boyfriend and I have ever stayed in. After meeting my friend in Carpinteria last week for what was supposed to be a romantic getaway, but instead turned out to be one horrible night at the Best Western Carpinteria Inn (yuck!), he surprised me with make-up night down in San Diegoâ€¦at one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in! The location, the room, the bed, the quiet, the breakfast, the service, heck even the prices were all the very best; it was truly spectacular. We were treated like royalty, the polar opposite of the way we were treated at the Best Western in Carpinteria. After a nice, but somewhat wearying drive down south from Ventura, we started the evening in a luxurious hot tub with our cocktails, which along with the pool, was located right on the edge of the yacht club. After a refreshing dip in the gorgeously appointed pool, we went up to Mission Beach for food and fun, then back to this lovely hotel for romance. Every aspect of this stay in San Diego was marvelous, starting with the hotel. The staff was so polite and accommodating, and the morning after we were treated to the best breakfast I have ever enjoyed. This was no continental breakfast...we had a world class chef prepare some of the best tasting eggs, potatoes, and meat weâ€™ve ever had. There was plenty of juice and fresh fruit, and the view was awe-inspiring. Then before we checked out, we sat out on the balcony overlooking the pleasure craft in the harbor below. I never wanted it to end. The only complaint we had was the fact they charged us for parkingâ€¦but considering the low cost of this luxury hotel, it was no biggie. I recommend this to any and all travelers. You will NOT be disappointed. Sandy

Reviews.Title: “relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: HDkids
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, we were greeted by Amanda. What a sweetheart. Very clean room, little older bathroom but nice, great breakfast, great places to walk. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: FunLes
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We were traveling with our 2 younger children and the hot breakfast every morning was a hit with them. From the time we arrived until the time we left, the staff was great, very friendly. I loved the location and the view from this hotel, we will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: idajimmi
Reviews.Content: we loved the Bay club, it is an older hotel but very well maintained. the rooms are large and comfortable, it is nice to have a refrigerator and coffee maker in the room. .Each room has a large flat front HD TV. It is also nice to receive free wireless internet in the room. I just have one complaint, some of our towels were very worn and thin, the hotel needs to buy new towels. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: telkwa68
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted by friendly helpful staff. The room was very clean and the views were fantasic. We all enjoyed the breakfast . This hotel is a great advertisement for San Diego.We will return .

Reviews.Title: “we were treated like royalty !”
Reviews.Author: IrelandEisha
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because it was not part of a chain of hotels, it overlooked a marina and the price included breakfast.We stayed 3 nights before and an additional night after our cruise . The hospitality of the staff was exceptional. We were treated like royalty. We received first class treatment from all the staff with whom we came in contact. They were great ! We stayed in a room overlooking the marina ... a very good choice ....uninterupted views of the marina. The room was comfortable and spacious with all usual amenities. We had uninterupted nights' sleep .........a really quiet atmosphere.....conducive to a restful relaxed night. We utilised the courtesy shuttle to and from the airport, to and from the cruise ship and into town. The location of the hotel was ideal for us. We highly recommend this hotel. Des and Eithne

Reviews.Title: “A place to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: nevadac
Reviews.Content: If possible, we often try to support local establishments, rather than chains.We were not disappointed. We spent one night before we left for a cruise out of San Diego. The staff was great. We got an airport pick-up promptly, and were taken directly to the hotel. We decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant, and it was convenient and nice. The hotel is between the bay and the marina, offering a pleasant view in the dining room. The room was comfortable, although a bit dated. It was clean and pleasant. Breakfast was included the next morning, and was more than we expected. We were taken to the cruise terminal at our preferred time. This was a good start to a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the week!”
Reviews.Author: basketmommie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week to celebrate our anniversary. As soon as we walked into the lobby, we were treated very well. Since this was our first visit to the area, the man at the desk gave us suggestions of places to visit and eat. He gave us some discount coupons for meals and sightseeing that were very useful. Our room had a great private view of the marina. We enjoyed the breakfast included in our price. The food was good (had eggs every day) and we liked the service. We both felt the location was very good. It was near the airport and only a short tript o downtown. From the front of the hotel we had a great view of San Diego. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel stay.”
Reviews.Author: KayceeD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night and liked it so much we booked another night. Rooms are large and clean with large plasma tvs. The breakfust buffet is awesome; fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon and/or ham, and dishes that rotate depending on what day it is. Be sure to request the marina view since this looks directly over the boats. The "harbor view" does overlook the harbor via the view of the parking lot! Even so, lots of greenery and flowery plants make this a beautiful hotel. We had a car so the location wasn't an issue (out on Shelter Island). Nothing is far in San Diego so we didn't have any problem getting to different touristy type things within a short amount of time. Parking fee is $5, which is not bad considering what some hotels charge for this in downtown San Diego. They do have shuttles to various things, but we didn't delve into what these entailed. The staff is friendly and helpful. The pool and jacuzzi are plexiglassed in. As they face the bay, it's nice in that the breeze off the water is shut off while the sun shines directly on the pool so it's usually nice for swimming. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: SLPgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed everything. The beds, the room, the view, the service and the food were all outstanding with a great value. We booked directly with the hotel for an online advertised price and this was a real value as it includes a full breakfast in the morning. The only reason I did not give this hotel 5 stars is it is getting a little worn around the edges, doors need replacing and one room upstairs overlooking the marina had a strong smell of mold. Two other rooms on the first floor overlooking the marina were great. Definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! loved it!”
Reviews.Author: darjen
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. It all started one night when we called to look into reservations and got Tim the front end manager on the phone. He was so pleasant and helpful and gave us a great deal that we booked are reservation. Plus he was a Celtics fan. Are rooms were spacious and comfortable and clean. The veiw of the bay was beautiful. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The buffet breakfast was delicious. Are waiters Raul and Jerry went above and beyond, they would have are tea and coffee waiting for us at are table. We saw a segall every morning on the rail why we ate breakfast. Raul told us the story of the segall and that his name was Steve. The kids looked forward to seeing Steve every morning. The pool area is beautiful and relaxing. I can't say enough about this hotel except that we recommend it and we will be back. Book It!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the accomodations and service.”
Reviews.Author: Drizzt_Calgary
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Bay Club Hotel and Marina for 4 nights in January. We flew into town for the last Chargers game and decided to spend a few extra days sightseeing. We chose this hotel for three reasons: a) Its comparitable nightly rate b) Its free breakfast c) its excellent reviews in Tripadvisor. As with most people who use this sight A and C played the most important role. We were very happy with the accommodations. Our room was large and clean; considerably larger in fact then the standard hotel room. Because the reviews are so positive it did catch us a little by surprise how old this hotel is. It had a bit of a musty odor when we first walked in but it wasn't serious and everything is maintained well. A big benefit for us was the full breakfast offered each day. During all our stay, the staff were friendly and helpful. We were specially impressed by the service during breakfast. The location as mentioned in many other reviews is excellent for walking along the harbor and watching all manor of boats including large military vessels and cruise ships. It should be noted however that the area around this hotel is relatively industrial. There are other hotels close by and several restaurants, but the main road is populated with marina entrances, yacht brokers, boat storage yards and other assorted commercial enterprises. Maybe it was because we were then in January but while walking the main road at night, it was pretty much dead. Overall we would highly recommend this hotel. After a fair amount of research itâ€™s one of the best you will find in San Diego which combines a good price with a good location and a good room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: symesa
Reviews.Content: Our girls weekend to San Diego included a 3 night stay at the Bay Club and it was fantastic! Two of us took the King Suite, the other two took a next-door Queen double and it worked out perfectly! Shelter Island was a fantastic location. It was quiet yet close to everything including the water! There was no traffic. We couldn't hear the commercial aircraft even though we were close to the airport. Honestly, the perfect location! The free breakfast was a wonderful addition even for a picky health nut like me (they always had oatmeal and fresh fruit). The staff was very helpful and our rooms were just right!

Reviews.Title: “BOOK IT!”
Reviews.Author: clearlit
Reviews.Content: I came across the Bay Club after being totally frustrated with numerous other local hotels that would not guarantee the room we booked, namely a harbour view, would be the room we got upon arrival. I searched ratings on TripAdvisor and came up with the Bay Club, called and hit the jackpot when Tim, the front desk manager, answered my call. He was patient beyond patient, helping me navigate my way around their website so there would no suprises when we arrived for a family Christmas get-a-way. It just kept getting better from there....EVERYONE at the Bay Club was fabulous. All of our requests were filled, information was searched for, coupons, advice, recommendations - things to avoid as well as things to see - just awesome. Can't thank everyone enough. Breakfast is awesome...our family has junk food addicts through health food freaks - we all left satisfied daily. The restaurant is great, the lounge fun and full of atmosphere - GO CHARGERS!! I could go on and on...but I'll spare you and just say BOOK IT! You won't be disappointed! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Really comfy beds and pillows!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaM3
Reviews.Content: I usually hate hotel beds and can't sleep well but the beds here are amazing! We all woke up feeling great and ready to go! Great views of the marina and the best complimentary breakfast buffet ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “All we needed, and then some.”
Reviews.Author: stevem3609
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend in San Diego, and are glad we chose Bay Club for our three-night stay. Once again, TA reviews have done us well. I called front desk beforehand, and friendly staffer suggested i book marina view room on first floor. Room was plenty big, small fridge but no microwave. Nice new TV, and comfy beds. Costs $5 a night to park, which seems crazy, but that's cheaper than other San Diego hotels. Just minutes from the airport on Shelter Island, it's very easy to get anywhere in San Diego area. Complimentary breakfast, while not the greatest we've ever had, was more than adequate. And, Steven the white seagull that eyes you from outside the dining area, is a hoot. Very friendly, helpful staff. Lots of local dining -- had a nice meal at Pompardos, and the Bali Hai (OK food) is worth going to for history and great views. Highly recommend tour of the USS Midway and San Diego Zoo Wildlife Park, if you looking for things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Affordable, Great Location........”
Reviews.Author: AnewMunsterfan
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club offers amenities, relaxation, and great staff. Everyone was most willing to help us. Their van will take you almost anywhere you want to go. Rooms are spacious and beds are comfortable. Walls are a bit "thin" but we didn't have any major complaints. Full breakfast every day -- included in the price. Not gourmet but it is a good value. We loved the atmosphere of this small hotel. The location on the marina sets this property apart from other places we have stayed. Shelter Island is safe and the paths for walking can't be beat. The little bar was enjoyable for chatting and watching the world go by. Decor is a bit dated, but all in all.......a great experience. My husband and our family friends had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lolasmom67
Reviews.Content: Very clean and great staff. Lovely restauraunt overlooking Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne123
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We stayed here for two nights with our teenage son at the end of October. The room was large and had an excellent view of the marina. The breakfast was excellent (and was included in the room rate). We stayed in several hotels in California during our holiday and this was bar far the nicest and best value. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Overall excellent value. I would love to stay here again one day.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Proud_Canadian_eh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights after our Mexican cruise. The staff are great, the breakfast is good and plentiful, the location and views are wonderful. The rooms are large and the beds comfy. Free wi-fi and big screen HD TV are always appreciated. A regular checkout of noon is a nice touch, and they allowed us to extend to 1:00pm with no problem. Dinner in the restaurant was good, but not great. Parking at $5 per night is a good price, but free would have been better :-).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: GopherJim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights at the Bay Club for our Honeymoon. While it's NOT the most lavish hotel you'll ever go to, it's still above average. I had to rate it high, because it deserves the rating. We had a balcony room on the 2nd floor that faced the marina. Wonderful view. The room was slightly outdated, but still in very nice shape and was definitely kept well. We were very happy with the friendliness of the front desk staff. We didn't have a lot of questions over the course of our 7 days, but when we did, they went out of their way to help us either find a destination or print out our airline boarding passes. The complementary buffet breakfast was more than sufficient to get our morning going in the right direction. Even though it's complementary, it's expected that you tip the server, even if it's just for getting you OJ or milk. They do a nice job making sure there is ALWAYS food ready. We ate at the Bay Club Bar and Grill for 2 of the 7 nights and were happy with the food and service, while the price was fair. We never took advantage of the pool or hot tub, but they looked very inviting. We really enjoyed going to the park/beach areas that were right across the street from the hotel. This location was perfect for us, as it was away from the hustle and bustle of everything, yet was close enough (a few miles) from all of the main San Diego attractions. One last thing...Expect to pay $5 per night parking, which was no big deal to us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find!!”
Reviews.Author: TTPCalifornian
Reviews.Content: My elderly mother and I stayed two nights at the Bay Club, and loved it. I had seen it recommended in a newspaper article about "affordable lodging on the Coast", and am so happy I booked there. The staff was friendly and efficient, our room (second floor with Marina view) was spotless and comfortable. The view was amazing. The included breakfast was very good, and the dining area looks out on the marina. The food is constantly replenished, even if you come to breakfast at 9:30. I would highly recommend it, and hope to find a reason to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy & Comfortable hotel in a Scenic Setting”
Reviews.Author: Meet-the-Furkids
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for our 2 night stay in San Diego, as we wanted a more tranquil setting rather than downtown. Total price for the room was Â£125, so a really good deal. Check in was really friendly & they upgraded us to a suite, for no extra charge. The Bay Club is located on Shelter Island. Great views across the bay to downtown San Diego & the naval base. The other side of the hotel is a picturesque marina. The hotel has a kind of cosy, nautical theme & whilst a little dated, still manages to retain charm & character. Our suite was really big with a lounge, bathroom & separate bedroom. A small balcony looked out onto the bay. The bed was comfortable & the bathroom functional. The lounge area was fine for watching a bit of TV â€“ we were hardly in the room as we were sightseeing, but it more than met our needs. Wi-Fi is provided in the rooms The car park is located in the basement & is convenient. Housekeeping is efficient & the rooms and communal areas are kept clean & tidy. The pool is heated & more than sufficient, with loungers available. There is also a hot tub by the pool. A complimentary breakfast is provided each morning & this was really good. Lots to choose from â€“ continental, hot items, pastries etc. We enjoyed this before setting off on our days out. There are restaurants, take-outs, Starbucks, Mcdonalds etc a few minutes drive away. The hotel location is great. We had a walk along the beachfront each day & there is a little fishing pier, just up the road. The Humphreys Hotel next door, has a large outdoor concert venue, which can be seen from the pool & seating area of the Bay Club - a plus point, if there is a music event on! Obviously you need a car to venture farther afield, but I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting San Diego on a fly drive. We went to SeaWorld, Gaslamp quarter, Downtown plus a drive all around Point Loma. All in all, the Bay club was really good value for money & the service was good. I would definitely recommend to others & if I were to visit San Diego again, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The view couldn't be better in this charming club-like hotel”
Reviews.Author: svwriter
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club is on Shelter Island in San Diego Bay. Rooms either have a Bay View or a Marina View, and are expansive with flat screen tv's, mini fridges, and large dressing areas. We enjoy the complimentary full breakfast, but we also have enjoyed lunch and dinner around the sheltered pool. The staff must love to work there--they are always upbeat and will go an extra mile to point you to local attractions and other restaurants. The hotel is close to downtown and to freeway access, but you are close to the water and can be entertained just "hanging out". In fact our adult children do just that, and the grandson loves the pool. Oh yes, the Beach Boys were playing at Humphreys next door, on their terrace, so we got to see and hear them live and in person from the pool deck. Only downside, you have to ask for ice at the bar. I understand why, otherwise the local boaters would drain the ice machines. But it is always cheerfully supplied.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL FOR SHORT STAY”
Reviews.Author: westiebigfoot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bay Club and Marina for 3 nights in Sept 09. Nice hotel in a good spot which is 30mins drive from downtown San Diego. Room was a nice size, bathroom was a little tired but this is not unusual in hotels I have visited. Had the use of a nice pool which overlooked the marina. Overall I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, service, value, friendliness and position, position, position!”
Reviews.Author: jenrobbo
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 9 yr old daughter booked this hotel via internet and stayed for 2 nights. I could have happily seettled myself there for a month! From the moment we walked into the foyer we experienced the friendliest staff, the most gorgeous scenery, spotless, roomy suite and tasteful decor. Breakfast was a feast with everyone catered for. We had a marina view room with balcony and enjoyed watching the tide come in bringing with it an array of ocean life. The hotel was elegant with long marbled hallways, lush carpeted staircases, heated pool with food and drink service and a jacuzzi. If in San Diego again this hotel will be our first stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: joannefry
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, beautiful view of Shelter Island, great service at the front desk and restaurant staff, great complimentary breakfast. Rooms were spacious, though abit outdated. Bathroom could have used some new tiles, grout, etc. Only other con was that it is not centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful in every way”
Reviews.Author: happyPhoenix_Az
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in two Marina view rooms. View is beautiful and it is very quiet and relaxing on the marina side of this small hotel. Breakfast was delightful with indoor and outside tables. Staff, especially at breakfast were very attentive and friendly. Location is very good for seeing all the sights. There are about 10 good restaurants within half a mile (easy walking). This is a really good vacation or business choice.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: marine89123
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean & modern, excellent breakfast buffet, great service, friendly staff, best location in SD. We travel to SD often and love Shelter Island. We have always stayed at a hotel next to Bay Club, but was full this time. Bay Club is outanding. Will stay here from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten path but close to all things San Diego. While the facility is older but it is well maintained. Dont expect the Hilton or Hyatt but expect a very enjoyable stay. I was afraid at first by booking a non brand name hotel and fears were quickly put to rest. The customer service is excellent, especially Tim. Complimentary breakfast buffet is offered and typical. Waffles, potatoes, eggs, fruit, bagels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: prettybirdHawaii
Reviews.Content: Ambience was wonderful. The hotel is centrally located to the main city of San Diego where you can go shopping, dinning, and to the tourist attractions. We enjoyed the full breakfasts the best with a "hungry" visitor with cute eyes (seagull) who came to our glass partition wall near the dining room every morning to greet us. We are from Hawaii, so we don't get to see many seagulls. We believe that he was a friend of the waiter there. Staff was nice and courteous and the rooms were clean and descent. We had a very relaxing time there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: lcky7
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous as we pulled onto Rosecrans Street on our way to the hotel and saw some establishments that were a little 'seedy' in nature. I was very happy that I saw none of those places on Shelter Island Drive where the hotel is! The desk clerks were quite friendly and answered all the questions we had about the area. We were on the 2nd floor with a great view of the bay from our balcony. The room was very large, as was the counter area outiside of the bathroom. The carpet looked fairly new and there was a new large flat-screen television. The counter and bath/shower tile could use some up-dating, but I would not let that deter me from coming back. The rooms were clean and noise was not an issue. There was an in-room safe (no extra charge) and a microwave and refrigerator. The $5.00 parking fee was reasonable and they had underground parking. The buffet breakfast was excellent, as was the wait staff. Great service. We had dinner in their restaurant one evening and the food was very good. If we ever come back to San Diego, I would go back to the Bay Club Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, for us service second to none!”
Reviews.Author: TomCarluke
Reviews.Content: As part of our Californian holiday we stayed for 5 nights at Bay Club Hotel. After 1st night we were upgraded to what we believe was best room within complex. Staff could not be anymore helpful, in particular Front Office Manager Tim Brogan who could not have done any more for us. When asked for advice on where to eat, he not only gave advice but proceeded to book a table and arrange transport. My wife and I were on a golfing holiday and again Tim not only accessed information on various courses, but called and arranged best deal for us. If visiting make a point of speaking to Tim.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: peejay_dk
Reviews.Content: The title is not exactly true, because when we checked in we were offered a room at the end, with views to the next door dump, and peeks towards the marina on one side and bay on the other. This was not exactly what we had expected and hoped for, but the very friendly front desk staff then put us at second floor with marina and pool view instead. Thanks. This gesture really saved our stay. As an added bonus we got backrow seats (i.e. from our balcony) to the Humprey concerts next door with Greg Almann and Cowboy Junkies. Great deal. The hotel looks a bit worn, but the rooms are big and comfortable with all necessary amenities, the service was excellent and the location absolutely great. What's not to like? Well, maybe the ignorant jerk at the pool who let his son terrorize the other guests with a water gun, but that's a different story.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to enjoy San Diego”
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th time at the Bay Club and enjoy it every time I'm in San Diego. They go out of their way to accomodate.Don't pay attention to some of the "gripers" who complain about food and free breakfast,most likely these are people who would never be satisfied no matter where they stay.We stayed 5 days this time and ate breakfast and dinner there everyday and every night,why go somewhere else when our dinner meal at night was as good as any hotel we have ever stayed at in California. The staff is all about making your stay as pleasant as possible and go out of their way to help.Great location !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Bay Front Hotel, a Jewel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: AzPattycake
Reviews.Content: This hotel is why I love small properties. A lovely 2 story property with a weathered appearance as you approach giving it great character. Professional and accomodating front desk, cozy lobby, nice bar with a great happy hour. Nice included breakfast in the morning which you can eat inside or out by the pool. (eggs, bacon/sausage, french toast or pancakes, fruit, juice, coffee, cereals, breads/bagels, pastries - something for everyone.) By the third day they knew I liked to eat outside and drink decaf. It was there by the time I finished making my buffet choices. Impressive. Rooms have a polynesian south pacific feel. My room was an executive room on the second floor with a double balcony overlooking the marina. (Bay and city views if your room is on the front of the hotel). Beautiful breeze when I opened both balconies. King bed (nice firm mattress) and sofa bed. Nice excercise room on parking level, self coin laundry there as well. Pool area was nicely landscaped, deep end is 5'. Nice hot tub. Nice loungers around pool (not the cheap kind). The sun umbrellas have marble bases. Very clean inside and out. Not a new hotel but that is part of the charm. Located between Humphreys and Best Western Island Palms. Humphreys has nice concerts so during season they probably get overflow at the Bay Club and that might make it a little busy or noisy but plan accordingly if that sort of thing bothers you. Grayline tour company picks you up right in the front of the hotel for sightseeing if you don't want to drive. There is a walking/jogging path and pier across the street from the hotel. Cruise ship passed by right in front of us. Lovely sight. Free wireless internet throughout hotel. This will be my hotel of choice whenever I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I consider the Bay Club to be a real find”
Reviews.Author: EarlyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Club Hotel & Marina in March 2009 during our weeklong trip to Legoland, San Diego Zoo and Sea World. We had never stayed here before; I was looking for a hotel that had a safe, central location and was reasonably priced. Even though my husband is pretty picky, we were both very satisfied with our stay. The room was good-sized and although somewhat dated, it had everything we needed, including two queen beds, a microwave, and a coffee maker. We were on the first floor with a view of the marina. Unlike some of the reviews I've read about this hotel, the place was pretty quiet. We appreciated the free breakfast buffet (which included several hot items.) My daughter really enjoyed the breakfast burrito. We had dinner in the restaurant the first night we stayed - we ordered off of the bar menu. The grilled salmon over greens was extremely good. The staff was competent and very nice, especially in the restaurant. It's not new or glamorous, but I consider the Bay Club to be a real find and would definitely stay there again when I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Bay Club Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susaperson
Reviews.Content: Just home from a wonderful week at this hotel. My husband and I were very happy with our stay. Our room was in the front on the Bay Side on the second floor and was very roomy, we enjoyed the breezes off the bay and watching aircraft carriers,fishing boats, pleasure crafts and all sorts of vessels go by. We could even watch military jets take off from our room. Shelter Island is a handy location away from the city, close to the airport with a wonderful path for walking, or jogging. We had a view of city and a beautiful view of the bay at the same time. It is also a short ride to Point Loma and the lighthouse, a park not to be missed. The hotel was so clean anywhere you looked and the people at the desk extremely helpful. The breakfast was good and the dinner in the restaurant was delicious. We asked for more towels and were given lots. The in and out ease of being in a 2 story hotel was so much more comfortable than always grabbing an elevator in a high rise. It is not a modern high rise and to me that is the charm of the place. We were not charged for parking which was easy in their lot or in the well lit parking garage underneath, we used both. Being by the water was great! The very first night the woman at the desk suggested we take a walk on the path down to the pier and we saw pelicans and a seal right from where we were standing. My husband even took a dip in the water across from the hotel although it was chilly. We also swam in the hotel pool which was spotless and soaked in the hot tub. The Bay Club Hotel offers a wonderful location, we had no problem with the music from Humphreys, we even went over one night to enjoy it. No outdoor concerts were available while we were there so we were not impacted by that.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: californiatravel_9
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, very satisfied. was driving on the PCH and so i called the hotel earlier and said that i would check in past midnight. reached hotel at 1.30 am, the front desk clerk Rhonda had everything ready, she did not even ask my name, she said i believe you are Mr. X, our last guest for tonight, I said yes and within two minutes i was checked in and was in my room in the next five, very nice marina view premium room in the corner, very clean room and bathroom, beautiful decor, big windows overlooking pool and marina on shelter island, comfortable king bed, had a small balcony with a couple of chairs overlooking the marina. excellent professional service. good warm breakfast. although i would have liked it to be extended till 11 am instead of 10am,, as this is not a business hotel but a leisure hotel. They took five dollars for parking for three days. Nice hot tub and pool area. Very quiet neighborhood. I even printed out my boarding passed on the last day at no extra charge. free wireless internet and they would even give a wireless adapter if your laptop does not have one for free. my girlfriend bought a watermelon to eat in the room and we gave it in the kitchen and they had it cut and delivered to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: floridabonds
Reviews.Content: I can't figure out all the good reviews either. I just checked out today after staying here 5 nights on business. The location is good - nice views. The hotel is old and tired and the pool was out of service for the week. I had a king room with a view of the marina. Old, dirty looking carpets in the room and hallways. Rooms and hallways are very dark. The bed was comfortable and water pressure was excellent. The room smelled very badly of mildew. I complained the next morning and they must have sprayed something in it because the smell was not as strong when I came back later in the day after work. There are no ice machines in the hotel. You have to take your ice bucket and have it filled at the bar all the time. Very inconvenient. The breakfast buffet is ok, not great, but they expect a tip and they leave a receipt at your table for you to sign and have it charged to your room. I can understand tipping at a buffet if the waiter/waitress brings you coffee/tea/juice and is very attentive. However, I was eating breakfast alone and ended up getting my own drinks all the time. Breakfast consists of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cut up fruit, bagels which seemed stale, and other breads and a limited amount of cereal. My co-worker and I made the mistake of eating dinner at the hotel our first full day. We were both sick all night. Maybe we should have taken the hint since no one else was in the restaurant, only the bar area. There are many other very nice places to eat in the area, just not here. They also charge $5.00 per 1/2 hour to use the computer in the lobby that is only for guest use. They charge $5/day for parking. The parking lot is small and they also have an undergroup parking garage. There are many other nice hotels in this price range. Unless you really want this location, shop around. I will not return, and I will not recommend this hotel to my friends or co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “This is not the place for us”
Reviews.Author: sunny_island
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of positive reviews on TA for this hotel which is more of a motel truth be told. It is not in a quiet area as I had read as it sits so close to Humphrey's which has concerts at night. That isn't the only noise problem, though. The one night we were there we were kept awake late by the noise of unattended children in the pool! The A/C worked sporadically but never well enough to keep the room cool. This is a very dated and tired place. With some attention and a bit of a remodel It could be much better. The breakfast was acceptable but not wonderful - the breakfast room looks out to the marina which is very pleasant if your table is near a window. There were some very odd things about the room (Premium King View Room); the bathroom mirror has a thick deep frame which so interfered with the outlet as to make that, the only outlet in the bathroom, unusable. This may not be a problem in all rooms but who would expect it at all? The management seems quite stingy with amenities; not an extra towel, washcloth or glass to be found, for instance. The good things about the Bay Club: the location on Shelter Island is nice (although too near to Humphrey's). The Marina view is good (but the "Bay view" actually looks across the parking lot and street to the Bay beyond). The rooms are good in size. The bed is comfortable. Parking is cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Super deal, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Docks66
Reviews.Content: Had not been to San Diego in 30 years and having just returned froma month in Asia was not too keen on getting on the plane but old college friend suggested a 4 day jaunt from Vancouver. Writing review a year later as just received e-mail from Bay Club re some upgrades and it reminded me what a great place it was.Had a shuttle service that would take u anywhere downtown and would even pick u up again when u wanted to return.Wanted to rent a car for a day and front desk quickly arranged best price ever and of course we were driven and picked up. Hotel staff also gave us advice re. our day trip up the coast.Location terrific for walks and lots of fine restaurants on the island.Breakfasts were outstanding at the Bay Club and included in the bargain room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Club By Far The Best”
Reviews.Author: el-voeco
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club Hotel & Marina in San Diego was by far the best hotel that we stayed in on our road trip around California this summer. The Hotel itself is a large building right on the water, with a superb view from the front of the hotel and back. The staff were the most friendly that we encounter in our many hotel stays along the way. They were helpful, funny and very polite. Rooms are very spacious, with balconies over looking the Marina if your room faces the back. And a view of San Deigo Bay & city skyline if your room faces the front. The rooms have HBO and satellite television & films to order. The rooms have good sized bathrooms equipped with bath and shower. The rooms also have coffee pots, fridge and a safe. The inclusive breakfast is not to be missed out, this breakfast includes cereals, coffee, tea, juice, bacon, eggs, sausage, potato, bagels etc. All served buffet style. In the evening the hotel restaurant was very busy, but did not slip into the pattern of if its busy you'll be waiting, As we were seated and sereved within minutes, the food was brilliant and the price was reasonable. The hotel also offers a bar, pool, hottub, shop, internet access, wifi. All round this hotel ticks all of the boxes as far as im concerned it was very pleaserable base to an excellent stay in San Deigo.

Reviews.Title: “perfect quiet getaway!”
Reviews.Author: dundeeplace
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quick anniversary get-a-way in a sunny winter spot. This hotel takes wonderful care of anniversary couples! ! ! We booked through the hotel directly and were given a suite upgrade with a marina view on the 2nd floor. The view of yachts and gorgeous houses built into the hills beyond was relaxing. we could watch the sunset from our two balconies at night. Tim the night manager made our trip very special. Everyone knew our names and extras like free dessert and chocolate dipped strawberries and spa robes made us feel pampered. The room was spacious with a large flatscreen and updated bathroom. Free wifi throughout the hotel and a room safe were also nice. This is a small hotel and service is fast and friendly! The front desk personnel helped us make tourism reservations and suggested fun restaurants within walking distance. They even printed our boarding passes when we were sightseeing so we would get preferred seating on Southwest. The free airport shuttle is great and they picked us up in the evening at our restaurant too.(parking is about $5/night) The room and pool areas are very clean. We constantly saw staff cleaning, sweeping, pruning etc. This is a quiet place for couples and families. The restaurant and lounge might not suite single 20 somethings.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvMyChamp
Reviews.Content: Our only time for a vacation is around the New Year so we tend to stay close to home (San Fernando Valley). We are low maintenance travellers on a budget and rely heavily on reviews (Booked it through SD Visitors/Convention website w AAA discount). This hotel was very clean, quiet, our room was big and roomy, VERY comfortable bed with lots of fluffy pillows. Free Wireless access throughout the hotel was a huge plus for us. They were kind enough to warn us we may be inconvenienced by New Year's revellers as they were hosting a party downstairs -- didn't hear a thing. Our television was upgraded to a flat screen during our stay which was an added bonus. Breakfast is included and is PLENTIFUL: Your basic eggs, bacon, sausage, potatos and waffles, french toast or pancakes, fresh fruit, good bread selection and cereals for kids. There's a small coffee maker in the room but my husband preferred making the short trip downstairs in the A.M. to get coffee and the free paper. Skip the "bay" view rooms and go for rooms on the second floor with marina views. There's a small lounge (which also caters to the locals) with a flat screen. There's a small pool with Jacuzzi, but we didn't get a chance to use it. Hotel parking is $5/day, which is cheap. Staff was extremely accommodating. The location can be challenging if you don't like a lot of stop-and-go traffic to get to major highways. Close to Old Town. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, VERY QUIET, and Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: Travlin2
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th or 5th stay at the Bay Club Hotel, but it's been a few years since our last. Again, another wonderful stay. If you are interested in quiet and an outstanding location, this is the place. Any time we want to or need to stay in the San Diego area, we will always return here. The staff is wonderful, friendly, and very helpful. The rooms are nice and well kept. Of course, the EXCELLENT breakfast buffet (included) is also a huge plus! If you want quiet, off the "busyness" of crowded streets, and an excellent place for solitude - yet close enough to ALL San Diego attractions, this is the place for you! Especially, couples!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Bay Club Hotel & Marina”
Reviews.Author: squirrelsmom
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I had a wonderful vacation at the Bay Club December 20-24, 2008. We arrived early and were able to check in right away. We had booked a room on the second floor, but did not state a preference for a marina or harbor view. We ended up facing the harbor, which was absolutely beautiful. The balcony was very roomy. We enjoyed seeing boats in the harbor, and even saw a "parade of lights," which involved several boats parading through the harbor decorated with Christmas lights. I think the view on this side of the building would have been less attractive from the first floor, as it also overlooks the parking lot. The restaurant in the hotel faces the marina, and those views are gorgeous, as well. Our room was very spacious and clean. We appreciated the large amount of vanity/counter space, which was separted from the toilet and tub/shower. We enjoyed and appreciated the breakfast buffet each morning - it was so nice to not worry about where we would eat and spending the extra money each morning. We also dined in the restaurant for dinner twice, and the service and food were both excellent. While it was a bit too chilly to swim in the pool, my daughter and I ventured into the outdoor hot tub one day, and we loved it! The whole pool area is very well maintained and has great views of the marina. We were renting a car and loved the underground parking garage. We always found a place to park and felt very safe. It cost $5 a day, which we felt was very reasonable, especially compared with other hotels in San Diego. We were glad we had rented a car, and it was an easy drive from the Bay Club to the airport, downtown, the zoo, and the Cabrillo National Monument. Everyone we met at this hotel was kind, helpful, and provided excellent service. We are looking forward to the next time we can stay at the Bay Club!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rincewind64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in November for a family vacation. This is a great hotel in a nice location. It isn't fancy and shows some wear, but is otherwise very clean and tastefully decorated. The Shelter Island location is ideal for views of the bay and marinas, and there is a nice park across the street that runs along the bayfront, which is great for taking a morning walk/jog or just to watch the fishermen on the pier. Plenty of restaurants nearby too. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious. The free breakfast buffet was very good. Basic breakfast fare, but a lot of variety and always something different every day. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: flossyfizzdog
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel largely based on reviews on TA, and it fit our criteria well. We arrived at around 12pm, and our room was ready for us (although we weren't expecting it so early). We had lunch in the restaurant, which was very nice (I ordered the sesame chicken salad, which was delicious and HUGE). The helpful reception staff directed us on how best to get to the Las Americas factory outlet, near the Mexican border, and arranged a shuttle to take us to the trolley stop. After shopping all afternoon, we dropped our bags back at the hotel and walked about 10 minutes to a nearby Mexican restaurant that we passed on our way to the hotel. The hotel itself was quiet, very clean and comfortable. The only thing that was a little disappointing was breakfast, which another review had raved about, but we found it to be quite basic and bland. As far as value for money is concerned, though, this was a pleasant stay, and would definitely recommend it, particularly as the staff were very helpful, and the complimentary shuttle to and from the airport and/or cruise ship terminal is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful envrionment, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan71
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our stay at the Bay Club Hotel. The room was beautiful and clean. The free breakfast buffet was wonderful and it was changed up daily (pancakes one day, french toast another, scrambled eggs with bacon, scrambled eggs with chorizo, scrambled eggs with spinach). Raul and Jerry always made sure our coffee and juice was full and Raul even remembered us and gave us our "favorite" table. We only stayed for four nights and wished our stay was longer. We loved the location vs. where my sister-in-law stayed (Bahia resort). Her area was busy where our area was nice and calm even though there is a park across the street. It's also not too far from other places to go eat. From the hotel, turn right onto Rosecrans. You will find stores and places to eat and if you continue to Sports Arena Blvd. and turn left, you will have Target, Chili's, Baker's Square. It's because of the hotel staff we learned that. We checked in close to 10pm on a Wednesday night and they were nice enough to look up where the nearest Chili's was so we can get a bite to eat. We liked the fact that the sink/vanity area was outside of the toilet/shower area so that the two of us can get ready separately to save time. The bed was comfortable. The only "complaint" was they didn't have your normal fitted mattress protector (just a flat padding) under the fitted sheet and when you roll over, the corners would pop off which was a little frustrating but not a deal breaker. The staff was also very kind to print out our boarding passes for our flight out as well. Thank you to everyone at the Bay Club Hotel! Should we ever venture back to the San Diego area, we will for sure be staying at your resort!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient, Casual and Caring”
Reviews.Author: 1WaterBaby
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here several years ago and had a positive experience, so when we needed to be in the San Diego area again we checked the Bay Club Hotel web site and I found a very reasonable rate ... I think it was about $139/night. No room choice was allowed, but that did not matter, because we knew there were elevators pretty near all the rooms and we were not concerned about our view there. Our check-in was very friendly. Our room - #214 (see photo of room location diagram attached) was clean, fresh-smelling and, tho not large, was plenty roomy enough for us. The decor was not terribly high-end, but it was in good shape and pleasant. Our room was QUIET, although the air conditioner/heater gave off a bit of a mumble while it was operating. Room offered fridge, coffee/tea maker and lots of fluffy towels as well as basic toiletries. We found we liked being tucked away at the end of the 'little hallway' because we did not get a bunch of passing foot traffic from other guests. We had absolutely no problem parking our rental car fairly near the front entry. Also, they have a lively happy-hour in the bar, and a popular breakfast buffet with plenty of choices. Lots of restaurants in the vicinity, too, as well as evening entertainment. All in all, we would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: monos11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic and such a lovely end to our holliday but i must say that 4 days were not enough. we arrived to san diego after spending 6 days in Vegas, it was a completly different feel yes its not very modern but i loved it from the start it was more of a homely feel and i felt very relaxed. Our room wasn't ready when we got there as we did arrive before the check in time but the staff we're very helpfull and stored our bags for us untill the room was ready and showed us were the bar and other facilities were and recommended things to do while we waited. After taking a walk and having a few drinks at the bar our room was ready within an hour. When we got to the room we couldnt believe how spacious it was, we was on the second floor with a balcony with lovely views. The food is out of this world with a variety to suit everyone my compliments go to the chef at this hotel, my partner is quite a fussy eater but they were more then happy to change things slightly to suit his needs. The buffet breakfast was lovely i couldnt believe the variety of food that was available in some hotels its sometimes a very basic breakfast but they seemed to have everything. The staff are very friendly and took the time to chat to us which made us feel more at home and relaxed and they were more then happy to help us with our needs. What made this holiday really special for me is that my partner also proposed whilst we was out there. The staff members all went out of there way to help him get what he needed and to also keep me out of the way, they helped to make the day very special. I would 100% recommend having a massage whilst your there it was out of this world. i had a full hour massage from head to toe and i felt so relaxed afterwards its the best i've had and compared to the prices in England i thought it was a great price. I've never been to a hotel were the staff are so friendly and helpfull and all the other guests were firendly and all loooked like they were having a great time we did not hear one complaint whilst we were there. I will recommend that if your planning at staying here the hotel offer a free shuttle that will collect you and return you to the airport just give them a call when your at the airport and the shuttle bus will collect you and it saves spending around $20 on a cab ride. What was also great about the hotel was that it was in the middle of San Diego Zoo and Sea world as we wasnt driving it made it easier to get a cab to each one and it wasnt too expensive. i would just like to take this opportunity to thank Laurie, Tammy, and everyone at the hotel for making us feel so welcome we will without a doubt be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: JhonB
Reviews.Content: Looking of a place to stay for a few days at the end of a Cruise. Found this on the internet and took my chances. Turned out to be a delightful surprise. Although the place was not brand new and sanitized, it is well maintained. We had choice of Bay View or Marina View. We chose the Bay view. 2nd floor was about 10 buckâ€™s more a night. The room was very large with a balcony that had room for the two of us to sit and look. There was a free breakfast buffet weekday mornings. We thought it would be so so, but it turned out to be a full breakfast buffet. With a large variety and plenty of food. Arranged for trips at the desk that was cheaper than if we booked with the tour company itself. We thought we had missed the bus to one sight and they offered to take us there, but they were able to call the bus and have them swing by and pick us up. The room was quiet and they had a small coin laundry which was great as we had a ton of dirty clothes from the cruise. There was a bar, restaurant and pool. I really liked San Diego and would recommend this hotel to anyone and will defiantly go back there the next time I go to San Diego which will be soon. I really liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Club is the Best in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: melissalovesjesus
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, the view, the free breakfast, the pool/hot tub, and the service and hospitalilty were the top reasons we will return. The hotel is older but it has a marine charm about it that makes it laid back and cozy. The food in the restaurant was fresh and delicious too! Our room was clean and a very comfortable bed. This is the best hotel we have ever stayed at in San Diego. Our friends stayed at the Marriot downtown, and paid twice as much with crappy service and no free breakfast. The staff was absolutely the best, making us feel like we were their #1 Priority! Thank you Bay Club Personell, your top notch service made are 18th anniversary so memorable. Dan and Melissa

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it,”
Reviews.Author: alohamomma
Reviews.Content: After reading the Trip Advisor reviews we decided to give this hotel a try, we are so happy we did. We stayed for 2 nights with our 2 young children. We arrived after a long day at Seaworld and we were greeted by the night manager who went over and beyond to help us. Our entire stay the customer service was the best we've ever had, from the front desk to the servers in the restaurant, much better than the 5 star hotels we have stayed at. The hotel is older and a bit outdated, but it is very clean and well kept. The free breakfast buffet was very, very good and saved us a great deal of money with our family of 4. We loved eating our breakfast outside by the pool every morning and looking out at the Marina. It was beautiful. The kids loved the pool & jacuzzi and they were both very clean. The price we received through the hotel with our AAA discount was very affordable compared to most (if not all) hotels by the marina and well worth it. We will definitely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed -- hoped for a lot more”
Reviews.Author: Freqtrav2
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous TripAdvisor comments I was really looking forward to going with my family for a relaxing week in San Diego. I was willing to pay significantly ($100) more for this hotel than other local hotels because of the full breakfast, pool, and positive reviews. Unfortunately, the first room we were assigned smelled very strongly of mildew. Yes, it had a nice view, but when you went on the balcony you could smell the cigarette smoke from the adjacent balconies (even though it is a non-smoking hotel). The in-room air conditioning units are loud and rattly, but the room was too stuffy without it. If you open the windows you will be awoken by traffic noise and smoke wafting into your room. The bathroom has a weak fluorescent bulb that buzzes. It's like being in a cheap roadside motel. The pool looked nice, but my child noted the mildew growing on the sauna wall, and my other child came down with an ear infection later that week. They said it didn't seem to have any chlorine. Breakfast is good, and that's a plus, but definitely not worth the extra money. We spent a lot of time driving around trying to find another place to stay. You are paying a Marriott price for a Motel 6 type of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: butkusmom
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our stay was wonderful; listened to concerts from our balcony, excellent housekeeping and front desk services. Highly recommend and will absolutely stay there when we go back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm...this hotel needs some work”
Reviews.Author: PatrickCLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bay Club in July...the best part was listening in the evening to bands at the adjoining outdoor concert venue. The worst was listening all night to an antique air conditioning system located only 3 feet from the pillow banging on and off all night...no sleep in 3 nights. The maids were all excellent, but the hotel is drab and in need of a facelift. Won't be returning, moved on to a nearby hotel which was far more relaxing, worth the extra expense and will give us far happier memories of Shelter Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: Vacation People
Reviews.Content: The Bay Club is an excellent hotel choice. Let me be specific in my accolades: 1. While the room could have used a little modernization, it was over-sized, had a small fridge, a nice balcony overlooking the marina, and the beds were large and comfortable. 2. The front desk staff -- especially Alejandra, Allison, and Gatia -- were incredibly accomodating. They gave us maps to tourist attractions, changed $3 into quarters for meters, made suggestions for insider places to go, printed our boarding passes, and always had a pleasant word and a smile. They were never too busy to help us. 3. A really good buffet breakfast was included in the room cost, and the servers -- Raul and Jerry -- were always ready with coffee and juice and clearing of plates. They made the meal relaxing. 4. Parking is only $5 a night. 5. The location -- on Shelter Island -- requires a rental car, but it's a quiet location out of the city. On one side is the Bay and a small park. Great for an evening walk. On the other side is a beautiful marina with thousands of boats. Yes, thousands.. By car, you're downtown in about ten minutes, and it's a straight shot. 6. The hotel next door has outdoor concerts. While some previous reviewers complained, we couldn't have been happier. From our pool area, you could see into the concert shed and we had no trouble hearing the concert. In the week we were there, we enjoyed concerts by the Doobie Brothers, Frankie Valli, and Ringo Starr. 7. The pool and hot tub were very well maintained and relaxing. They were always clean and the right temperature. 8. Also always available: coffee, computer, weekday paper We had a really good time here and we'd go back without hesitation and be happy to recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Neutral / Average Review”
Reviews.Author: rscaso
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, we stayed at the Bay Club Hotel based on the reviews. However, I'm beginning to think that some of the reviewers don't get out much. Reading the 5 star reviews should be taken with a grain of salt. So here's my take: 1. My overall rating is around 3.5 stars; 2. The location is excellent--easy access to airport and all touristie activities; 3. The location is quiet other than the Humphrey Hotel next door--don't plan on going to sleep until 11pm on some nights (loud music); 4. Even though the hotel is dated, that should not stop you from staying there; 5. We stayed on the 2nd floor with a marina view and balcony--you want this view (very relaxing); 6. Our room had two queens--the mattresses are very firm but the pillows have a lot to be desired; 7. The room itself is like your average hotel rooms; 8. They call their rooms air condition, I call them swamp cooler air conditon--if you're a light sleeper, they could be a bit noisy. 9. The hotel is smoke free, however, you do have your smokers on the balcony and down by the pool side; 10. There maid service is excellent--please tip them they do earn it; 11. The pool and spa is Ok; 12. There free morning breakfast is nothing to crow about--it's not your Embassy Suites breakfast meals though;13. The breakfast is premade for you to dish up--scrambled eggs, french toast or hot cakes, sausage and bacon, cold ceral, fruit, breads, muffins, and pastries--the coffee is OK; 14. Hotel staff was good; 15. Would I stay here again--yes but not during the summer--I think you can get better deals at nearby hotels for the same fees. Plus there's restaurants within 4 miles that would give a better quality breakfast for your dollar value.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Rupert L
