Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Diego so I did a lot of research before booking anywhere to stay. The Bay Club on Shelter Island is perfect. It's close to everywhere you would want to be whilst staying in San Diego but far enough away to be relaxing and peaceful. We booked a marina view room after reading some of the reviews on here and glad we did. It appears to be much quieter at the back of the hotel then the front due to the road outside and the Naval base in the bay. Having said that, as the evenings drew in the whole area becomes very tranquil. The only word of warning is that Humphrey's, next door, holds concerts on an open air stage overlooking the marina. Great if you like the artist, not so if you don't. If we'd known beforehand we could've rearranged our travel dates to coincide with some of the bigger name acts they have. Overall the Bay Club is clean, tidy, well presented with friendly staff and superbly located. Would we stay there again? Without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Family Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tdboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on a recent business trip and the location is just beautiful as the hotel is right in the heart of the marina. It is nice to come back after a long business day and have a drink on the terrace overlooking the pool and look out over the marina. The front desk was very helpful with directions and restaurant suggestions, when my room was not ready upon check in (I was early) they treated me to a drink, nice touch! While this hotel is a little old and worn and rooms could use a refurbishing the tropical decor is timeless and they keep it very clean so you do not feel that you have made a bad choice for your stay. Parking is only $10.00 a day and for San Diego it is a real bargain. While I was there on business I did notice that there were many families staying at the hotel. The free breakfast buffet is great and adds to the value of your stay. I stayed with a business group and booked on Orbitz but someone else in my party called the hotel directly and received a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SkierMomArlington
Reviews.Content: We (four of us) stayed in a one-bedroom suite - Room 274, that faced the marina and partially the property next door (Humphrey's Half Moon). The room was more than spacious, and very clean. Bed in bedroom was comfortable, and they gave us lots of pillows which I really appreciated. The pull-out mattress has seen better days, but my 7-year-old twins didn't seem to notice. The included buffet breakfast was very good, and the waitstaff was always professional, quick and courteous. The little outdoor pool and outdoor hot tub were perfect for hanging out after a day of touring, and it was additionally nice that you could get drinks from the bar and bring them out to the pool. The bar food was marginal - standard hotel bar stuff - we did it one night and never did it again. But the bartenders were great! We really enjoyed the marina view from our room (which we requested) but others may prefer the bay view (you look over a parking lot, a road, and then the harbor/San Diego skyline). One heads up: Next door - Humphrey's Half Moon is a hotel (not as nice as Bay Club, by the way, my husband has stayed there) and outdoor concert venue. Depending on which end of the building you stay on, you can hear (and even see) the performers from your balcony - so don't expect quiet before 10PM. On the flip side - you can get a free concert! We enjoyed Crosby, Still and Nash and the Indigo Girls during our visit. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gonow46
Reviews.Content: My wife along with another couple made reservations thru the hotel. We were using one of their promos, â€œDinner for two and a room with a viewâ€� for $189.00 plus tax that included free parking (usually $5.00) and dinner for two. The other night was $139.00 plus tax. A breakfast buffet is included for all guests. I spoke to Tim, the night manager and set everything up for our April visit. We booked one room with a Bay view and the other with a Marina view. I wanted to make sure that the balconies for each room were able to accommodate all four of us so we could use either balcony. Tim actually went and looked at the balconies and locked in the rooms. Unfortunately, the morning of our departure, the other couple called to say her husband was sick. I called the hotel to see what options we had. I know the hotel has a 48 hour cancellation policy but when I explained the situation and that we would re-book two weeks later the lady on the phone (canâ€™t remember her name) said no problem. Thank-you! They could have dinged us for the one night. Two weeks later the four of us arrive at the hotel at noon. We checked in at the front desk but only one room was ready. The other room would be ready around 3 pm. They took my cell number and said they would call when it was ready. We took all our bags to the room that was ready and had lunch at the hotel. The lunch was very good and no more expensive than your typical restaurant. Later we took a walk out to the grass area on the Bay side of the hotel. Excellent views. Just after 3 pm Tim called and said the other room was ready. We met Tim at the reservation desk and he said that the room we had taken our bags to wasnâ€™t one of the rooms he had reserved for us. Then he took us thru the Hotel and showed us about 6 different suites! Cool. Have never had that happen before. We ended up choosing a suite on the first floor on the corner with a Marina view for our friends. It had a HUGE balcony. We could have put 15 people on it. Since we now planned on using this balcony for our cocktail hour(s) my wife and I chose a suite with a Bay view on the second floor without a balcony. We had an excellent dinner at the hotel that was included in our package. Everything was cooked perfectly. Tim even came by to say hello. Nice touch. Service was good as well and the view canâ€™t be beat. The breakfast buffet was good both mornings. Bacon, sausage, eggs, fresh fruits, etc. with orange juice and apple juice. It wasnâ€™t very crowded which was nice also. The hotel is an older property but very well kept. We noticed they were refurbishing several rooms during our stay but never heard any noise. The staff was great. Thank-you, Tim and the rest of the staff. Would definitely stay at the Bay Club again. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTourist
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Shelter Island. I much preferred this property to my other stay at Kona Kai. Shelter Island is a thin strip of land, and the architecture of this building provides water views for all rooms. The service was excellent. I found this facility to be relaxing and peaceful. Shelter Island is a short drive from the airport and within walking distance of several restaurants. However, I would recommend renting a car if you stay here. I found it very easy to drive to all the attractions from here. There is a small public beach across the street and about a ten-minute drive to Ocean Beach. It is a quieter part of town if you're looking for a more peaceful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service, beautiful views of the bay”
Reviews.Author: Bunty2772
Reviews.Content: This place is maybe one of the best places that I've stayed yet. The hotel is right on shelter island which is a man-made island in San Diego. Every room has a view of either the marina or the bay. I paid for a premium harbor view room with two queen beds at $169 a night (note that this was the memorial day weekend). I was there with my wife and two little kids. The service at this place was par excellence, from the time we booked the hotel by phone. We checked in little late at 7:00 pm even though the check-in time was 3:30 pm but we called the hotel and they promised to keep our room and not to worry. Once we checked in, I was a bit disappointed by the view since my room was on the right half of the hotel and had less of the downtown view (but it still had a nice view of the bay). I asked the lady at the front desk if she could change our room to the other half of the building for a better view. She said she did not have anything right away but immediately told me that she could move us into another room the very next day. All we had to do was pack our bags and leave them in the room and they would take care of it. Sure enough, after we came back from the Zoo the next day, our bags were moved to another room with a better view of downtown and the bay. No problems whatsoever. The room itself was clean and well kept. Yes, it looked a bit worn out and linens were not very new. The tub in our second room did not drain very well but this was fixed the very next day without us complaining. There were also problems with the tap in the tub leaking a bit. But the decent size of the room and view made up for these shortcomings. The rooms come with complimentary breakfast which is in the restaurant right opposite the lobby with a nice view of the marina. The breakfast itself starts at 6:00 am and lasts till 10:00 am. We had breakfast for three morning there and no matter time what time we went, the food was always hot and no item was gone. And the waiters made sure that our coffee and juice cups were always full. Every single person behind the welcome desk was very courteous and friendly. When I wanted a suggestion for a nice family friendly place to go to for dinner on my birthday, the folks there suggested two or three different local places. We ended up at Pizza Nova which also had nice views of the marina. And you should try their Gorgonzola with Pear pizza. It was out of this world. There is access to the beach right across the street from this hotel. You can see early morning joggers strolling across this beach with their dogs. There were some benches that you could sit to watch sunrise of sunset or just enjoy the view. The place is also very close to downtown and there were many small restaurants around this hotel The only slight issue that I had at this place had nothing to do with the hotel itself. There is a naval training base of some sort right on the other side of this island. And there were some F-18's that took off in the middle of the night. I woke up with a shudder thinking that I was in the middle of the earthquake. However, this happened only one night. There were a lot more planes and helicopters flying around all morning. But my kids loved watching the planes and the helis. Overall, we enjoyed out stay in this hotel. It was a bit pricey but you dont get anything for less in San Diego. I would stay here again for sure and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great views, nice room!”
Reviews.Author: myteem
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer from Los Angeles said she was just there on April 25 for her 10 year anniversary with her husband - I was there the same weekend with my fiance for our 11th anniversary and one-year-pre-wedding celebration (to the day!). What coincidence! We loved our room on the 2nd floor facing the bay. We saw lots of boats coming in and out of the harbor while sitting on our balcony. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom sink/counter area was spacious, the staff was VERY friendly and welcoming, and the breakfast was filling. The only thing we didn't like was that the bathroom was dark and the water pressure was very low, so we had to take longer showers than usual. The decor is pretty dated and the comforters are pilled, but the sheets were pristine and soft. All in all, it was a very relaxing and romantic weekend. Parking was easy. The pool was crowded and it was very windy that weekend, so we stayed on our balcony the whole weekend. Take a walk along the water and stroll on the fishing pier.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Bay Club Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadtripaddict
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bay Club Hotel & Marina for four days this past April 25th. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and were eager to return to this hotel since we had stayed here many years ago and loved it. Tim (the night manager) was so helpful! He made our stay such a pleasant one. In fact, the entire staff was great. We were booked in a beautiful suite on the second floor, overlooking the marina. Since we had purchased the dinner and a view package we didn't have to worry about breakfast (which is complimentary with your stay anyway) and we also had dinner included each night. The food was great and they even allowed us to switch to having lunch on one of those days instead of dinner so that we could enjoy dinner out in San Diego. We had such a great time and most of it was spent simply relaxing on our balcony overlooking the beautiful marina. We will definitely return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Bay Club Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaborActivist
Reviews.Content: We did a global search for decent hotels in San Diego, keeping in mind safe location, close proximity to the main attractions and price. We had a past midnight arrival and also made a request for a crib that had actually not been put in the room. The front desk lady fixed the problem instantly and to my big surprise, it was a real wood crib, not one of those crappy playpens that other hotels give you. Breakfasts were absolutely delicious and serving staff was the most helpful and accomodating I can remember in a very long time. Rooms were clean and overlooked the marina (it was our request). We did not use their pool or hot tub, as we were so beat by the time we got into the room, with all the walking we did at amusement parks.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem on Shelter Island..”
Reviews.Author: Suze07
Reviews.Content: We loved most everything about this hotel. It was quiet, had beautiful views from just about everywhere, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and it was convenient to all the attractions San Diego has to offer. The room wasn't fancy, but was clean and big, with a little balcony overlooking the marina (and the beautiful sunsets). The $5 charge for parking is the cheapest we found at any other hotel in San Diego.Beds were comfy, tv was decent, and we had the option of 24 hour room service. We didn't use that option, as the hotel includes a full breakfast in the price of the room. We expected a continental breakfast, as you would normally be offered in large chain hotels, but no...each morning there was a full buffet breakfast served in the restaurant, and it was *good*! The pool is small but in a lovely setting, and surrounded by glass walls to keep out the wind. Across the street from the hotel is a beach and a wonderfully scenic embarcadero populated by friendly locals on their daily walk. I have no complaints about this hotel at all, and would absolutely stay here again (and plan to), as well as recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Two couples..........great service and value”
Reviews.Author: humboldtbay
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) stayed at the Bay Club prior to our cruise last week. The property was exactly as pictured on the web site and we were very pleased. The web site also mentioned a special, which we took advantage of.....a 2nd floor room on the marina side, full breakfast, including eggs, bacon and all the extras, full dinner, and parking for $189. Dinner was excellent and the seafood dishes were fresh and delicious. Every staff member was friendly and accomodating and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We parked our car for the duration of our cruise in a safe, underground area for a nominal fee and the shuttle took us directly to the cruise dock and picked us up there at the end of our cruise. The marina side is more quiet and we enjoyed watching the boats from our balcony in the evening. We also enjoyed a pleasant moonlit walk along the beach after dinner and felt completely safe. The rooms were very clean, but the only negative comment might be that the carpeting throughout the property was due for replacement soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway with a great view”
Reviews.Author: GLS6434
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. I would recommend getting a second story room so you get a good view of the bay or the marina. The view from our room and the restaurant was awesome ( we had a marina view). The staff was pleasant and accomodating. The food for the continental breakfast and dinner was good, but nothing spectacular. Compared to other hotels in the area, I thought it was a good value for what we paid. There is a pier and small beach within walking distance and it is close to Point Loma and Cabrillo National Monument which has some great tide pools. It's a 10-15 drive to Sea World and Mission Beach. If you have time, visit the USS Midway and take the tour. It is well worth it. Plan on 3-4 hours to see everything on the ship.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Bay Club”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful 3-night stay at the Bay Club. We had a corner room facing the harbor which was very clean and bright. The complimentary buffet breakfast each morning was very good with a great variety, always hot and plentiful. The staff was wonderful, always very helpful and friendly. We ate in the restaurant our last night for dinner and enjoyed our meals. It was fun stopping in at the lounge in the afternoons after a long day of exploring San Diego to take advantage of the happy hour each day and have Brandi make us yummy drinks or pour refreshing, cold drafts. As previously mentioned, the Bay Club is San Diego's best kept secret, and I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “West Side of Bay Club--QUIET !!”
Reviews.Author: SkipperTrippers
Reviews.Content: Two adult travelers and one senior mom arrived over the Valentine's Day weekend from Denver. This hotel was/is a fave of my mothers..she has been coming here for years with my dad. We treated each other to a 'memory-making' trip. Even tho dad wasn't with us, she was able to relive her special times here. We were pleasantly surprised as to its proximity to the Airport..only 2-3 miles away. We stayed on the second floor..(worth the upgrade) facing the harbour on the westside. We avoided the smoke from the beach fires that seemed to pop up on the beach across the street when the locals showed up...and the jet aircraft noice..and the street noise of traffic and the after hours crowd at Humphreys. We were close to all the points of interest..driving to Point Loma was very easy..going the other way..we drove to the Maritime Museum downtown...very easy to get to. Tickets $12 for adults and $9 for seniors. Our favourite excursion was the Whale Watching Tour with the Hornblower Boat Co. This was well worth the money! We took the 1:30 cruise and saw 4-5 whales breaching the surface and water 'geysering' out of their blowholes. Many dolphins and even saw large white jellyfish! Great for landlubbers like ourselves! The hotel's breakfast was PLENTY to get our day started each morning. We got to know our waiter "Luis" who has written a story about the three very special seagulls that arrive each morning to entertain the breakfast guests: "Nancy", "Tilda," etc. they all have names! Luis has been feeding them for 15 years and now they are somewhat trained, much to the delight of the children. For those of us who are kids-at-heart..we enjoyed this extra-special touch of human and animal poignancy. Luis needs to have a write-up about him in the daily news..I hope you will enjoy meeting him too. Our room was just the perfect size for the three of us. The room could use an updating, but everything seemed okay. We didn't spend much time in the room. We used the balcony to watch the boats come in-and-out each day. The ship traffic is marvelous. The U.S.S. Ronald Reagan aircraft carrier came into port! What a thrill to see a nuclear powered carrier!!!! Kids will love this hotel and all that there is to do. Whether it is walking the harbour 'seawalk' across the street, or just watching boats from your own balcony/lanai. The Navy was out with a small craft training dolphins one day...right out in front of the hotel! If you don't know what you are seeing, ask a local--they are all out doing their daily walks on the harbour front walk there across the street from The Bay Club. The San Diego Zoo is a must! This was a very satisfying trip. If we ever visit San Diego again, we will re-book our stay at The Bay Club again! Definately ! Good for kids, romantics, seniors, and families who want a travel-base from which to see the 'Diego.'

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Bay Club has its pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: SmilesCanDo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Club for seven nights while celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The gentleman at the front desk was very nice when we arrived. He gave us three rooms to check out and we picked the one we wanted, which was the original we booked overlooking the marina, which was awesome! An advantage to overlooking the bay would be seeing the large naval ships that come in; while outside we saw a cruise ship sail past one night. Reviews are correct in that it is an older property. The carpet is stained in the hallways from what looks like a leaky sprinkler system. It was hard getting past that first impression. The restaurant was very nice. It's been remodeled due to a fire late last fall. The morning breakfast that comes with the rental of the room was excellent with a large variety. They have a 4:00-7:00 social hour with crackers and cheese ONLY with a purchase of a drink at the bar! The rooms are clean. The bathroom tile is a terra cotta brown and the grout was stained in all three rooms we checked. I thought it might be from the humidity in the shower, but even the grout around the tile near the sink area is stained. I noticed the grout in the bathroom near the lobby was also stained. Not a good first impression. Staying at the Bay Club is hard if you don't rent a car. It's surrounded only by other hotels and marinas. After being out and about all day, it would have been nice to come back to our room, clean up and go back out for the evening. There wasn't anywhere to go from the Bay Club within walking distance in the evening except another hotel restaurant. We did get to know the bus system which goes to Shelter Island, which was still a bit of a walk. We had to transfer several times, depending where we wanted to go. We did take advantage of the hotel shuttle, but we were told over and over they usually only do airport shuttles, and because this was their slow time, they would acommodate us. They only want to shuttle you to Seaport Village. We wanted to go the same distance in a different direction one day, and were told they couldn't do it. It also depended on who you talked to at the front desk. Some were more friendly and accomodating than others. We felt we were pestering the shuttle drivers to drop us places. If done again, we would have stayed somewhere close to downtown where we could make a stop at our hotel if we wanted. Staying somewhere near Seaport Village where there's a lot of shops and is close to the Gas Lamp District, which was FULL of restaurants and evening activity! We felt a little slighted that we were there in March and not their busy season in June- August. The tours you read about are geared for those months. Not everything is available during their off season. We had our Hollywood tour cancel the night before because they only had 6 people instead of the 10 or more they required for a 15 passanger vehicle. This was a $100 a person tour. Hard to believe that they're not making a profit on $600. Maybe if they'd run the tour, the word of mouth advertising would be enough to get more people to go. All-in-all, we had a wonderful time in San Diego. We appreciated how different each area was.

Reviews.Title: “Marina view was awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: ColumbiaTrekkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bay Club Hotel as part of a 2 1/2 week trip along the California coast, starting in San Diego. The hotel is conveniently close to San Diego's Lindbergh Field Airport, but far enough away to avoid jet noise. The hotel is very convenient to Old Town and also to Downtown, but it also seems far-removed from all the crowds. It is also conveniently located near Point Cabrillo and Cabrillo National Monument. We stayed in a Marina view room, upper level with king bed, and we got a very good AAA rate of $159 by contacting the hotel directly. It might be helpful to describe the hotel's setting. I didn't quite understand it before I checked in, but was fortunate to have followed the advice of others in selecting a marina view room. This hotel (and others along Shelter Island Drive like Humphrey's) occupies a relatively thin strip of land with the marina on one side and Shelter Island Drive on the other. The so-called bay view rooms have a distant view of San Diego, a closer view of San Diego Bay; but they have a VERY close view of the hotel's parking lot, Shelter Island Drive, and the municipal parking lot on the other side of Shelter Island Drive. So, while some travelers may like the "bay view" rooms, my advice is choose the marina view. You can look out from your balcony over a beautiful marina (Marina View)or over a parking lot and/or busy road (Bay View). The hotel's breakfast buffet was the best of any hotel on our trip. It included eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes or french toast, pastries, bagels, fresh fruit, coffee, tea and juices. The great breakfast really spoiled us for the rest of the trip, as did the beautiful view from our balcony. Hotel management and staff were exceptional. They went out of their way several times to be genuinely helpful to us. We really enjoyed the Bay Club Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good service, but NOISY near Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: Nugie
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location on Shelter Island. The staff is friendly, courteous, informative and eager-to-please. The marina and harbor views are very nice. But if you want quiet nights DO NOT take a room on the Humphrey's side of the hotel. Humphrey's has live bands every night and they play LOUD until 1 or 2 AM, even on weekdays. You'll need earplugs or a sleeping pill do get a night's rest. After we complained, to the hotel's credit, they upgraded us to the captain's room on the other side of the hotel. They are in the middle of some remodeling, but we were not disturbed by workers or noise from this. It's nice to have a hot breakfast buffet included as well.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay at Bay Club”
Reviews.Author: Joe124
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bay Club Hotel from Dec 28th thru Jan 4th. We had a bay view room and enjoyed the experience. I read about debate between marina and bay view. Marina view is quiet but monotonous. Preferred bay view room, second floor. I rate this hotel as a 3 star hotel with 5 star service. Inspect your room before accepting it. Check the view, room accomondations, noise level. Not every room the same. We had to change our room 3 times because of minor issues. I learned the rooms are different. Some have balconies that are 2 feet wide while others have full side balconies. Rooms lack outlets for electronic equipment. We had problem charging cell phones and computer. Only one outlet for room. One room had noise from a kitchen fan. Otherwise, service was great, breakfast was nice with a variety of choices. They have underground parking for $5.00 per night. I noticed the pool is small. Bay view was nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: beegerb
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful location for a hotel in San Diego. We stayed in a two queen room with a bay view. The view was not awesome as you first see the parking lot, but it was nice. I would probably not worry about paying extra for the view here. I think the marina view is probably a little nicer, as the boats are right outside the hotel. This hotel seemed to attract a crowd of regulars, which we took as a good sign. The hotel is a bit older, but they keep it nice. The bathtub/shower is what tipped me off to that. The bathroom is on the smaller side with the toilet and tiled tub in a room and the sink outside it. The breakfast was included and was very good. I'd call it a buffet. They had waitservers, and did present a $0 bill, basically to get a tip. I thought this was okay since it was a nicely laid out full breakfast in a restaurant setting with white tablecloths. We loved the view across to downtown San Diego and also of all the sailboats in the marina. There is a nice sidewalk, running path along the bay. It is located at the bay level of the Point Loma area. It was easy to get to, and there were plenty of stores, gas, Denny's on the roads leading out. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a great view, a good breakfast, and a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: Kevben
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bay Club for four nights in November and was very pleased. I was actually going to a meeting at the Island Palms down the street, but a friend suggested the Bay Club because it was a little less expensive and included breakfast. It was a great visit. The room was clean and nice, the breakfasts were very substantial (eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, bagels, toast, cereals), and the staff could not have been nicer. I was originally in a room overlooking the parking lot, but when my wife decided to join me for the last two nights, I asked for a room with a little better view and Tim Brogan upgraded me to the Captain's Suite overlooking the marina. It was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay on marina side”
Reviews.Author: Californiatraveler30
Reviews.Content: we would stay there again. The breakfast was great and the view on the marina side was beautiful. We have two kids and it was pretty kid friendly, but It was more couples that were older. The hotel is a bit dated, but again totally worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mouser714
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful location, view, staff, room etc...Great value and quiet location. Staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Cozy Hotel on Shelter Island Dr.”
Reviews.Author: mariejolie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bay Club Hotel and Marina during a business convention. This was a really cozy comfortable hotel. The staff was wonderful. One of the managers, Tim, was really helpful in making reservations for us at a nice restaurant at the last minute. Breakfast was delicious, we stayed there for five days, and it was consistently good. My husband and I have been all over the country, and we were very impressed by this place. As some reviewers said, furnishings were a little outdated. We've stayed at some of the swankiest hotels in New York, and I would definitely choose this place over the more well-known hotels. We were on the first floor with a king-size bed, and the room was a very nice size for the two of us. The housekeeping staff did a great job cleaning and preparing the room. Waiters in the restaurant were very friendly. Overall, a really great choice for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Hollimg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three night stay at Bay Club. Loved the location, nice quiet area, you could walk right across the street and be on the bay and beach and watch the harbor. Room was plenty big enough for us and two boys. We had a marina view on the first floor. My kids loved it. They would go out on the balcony and look at hundreds of boats! Very pretty view. sometimes when the tide was in, they could see fish swimming in the water below us. I saw what others referred to as carpet stains etc, but that was just in the hallways and did not effect the room. Our room was clean. the breakfast in the AM is a big plus. The pool was well maintained. not super big but there never was very many people out there anyways so not a big deal. The staff was quite friends. I would definetly stay here again. It was easy to navigate from this hotel to Sea World, zoo, downtown, etc. Nice area.

Reviews.Title: “more than happy”
Reviews.Author: honeybee001
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 nights and were more than happy. We thought the location was spot on shelter island is a really nice place to stay. The hotel staff were pleasant, the breakfast buffet was amazing to say it was in with the price of the room, which by the way was very clean and spacious. Only $5 per day to park your car, and we got to hear foreigner at humphreys next door! The only thing we thought that could be improved was the carpet in the public areas, it really could do with renewing, but apart from that everything was fine, and would recommend bay club.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Charming, But...”
Reviews.Author: mizzmac
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, you cannot help but notice the amazing views of the San Diego Harbor and downtown skyline. So the Bay Club Hotel & Marina definitely has location going for it. The hotel's decor can best described as Trader Vic's meets Tommy Bahama. That said, the island motif was appropriate to the location and laid back attitude the hotel wished to announce. We reserved a harbor view room, but looking back, I wished I had requested a marina view as my husband loves boats. Plus a marina room is away from the street and a bit more quiet. However, the room we did have was nicely sized, and well appointed. The property has definitely seen better days. The condition of the public areas--particularly the corridor and restaurant carpets could use a good cleaning. Also, due to the humidity, the air from the ventilation system was a bit on the stale side. If you're planning to drive, be advised that the hotel has a parking lot, but it can be tight if you drive a larger SUV or pick-up. The hotel has a nominal parking fee ($5.00) compared to other hotels. However, there is ample on-street parking nearby as the hotel is directly across from a parking lot for boaters, and harbor visitors. In fact, we ended up parking on-street a few nights due to the hotel's lot being full. Overall, this is a charming place to stay, and we would visit again. You get a good value for your money and could do better (the Kona Kai Resort and Spa a little bit down looked nice) but also could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet, relaxed and just plain easy”
Reviews.Author: chinchinchin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading several reviews...and hoping that it's location would lend itself to an older quieter clientÃ¨le. We were very pleased! There were no rowdy families with hyper kids ready to attack Sea World or the zoo. No motor coaches full of teenagers. No big parking hassle. Just a casual gracious feel to the place. Lovely safe area to go for a walk, jog or birdwatch. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights at the Bay Club. The service was excellent and the complementary breakfast outstanding. Not only is it a full hot breakfast, but the friendly staff even bring your coffee or tea to your table as they politely leave a slip for your tip. The hotel is small enough that the staff remember you and anticipate your needs. And their attentive and helpful service is well worth a tip! The room was lovely and quiet. So quiet that from our bed, we could not hear each other using the shower. We faced the marina and enjoyed our balcony observing all the comings and goings of the yachting crowd. It was comforting to know that most of the evening there is a guard watching our car in the lot (preventing the concert crowd from parking in there.) I never heard any noise from Humphrey's concerts. We probably stay in 12 hotels each year and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: raidergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here August 16th through the 18th. We made the reservation back in May. We chose it because we were planning on attending a show at Humphrey's on the 16th and the rates were far better. It is literally right next door to Humphrey's and was a quick 2 minute walk across the parking lot to the show. No traffic or parking hassles. I had booked a premium queen room. When we checked in they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite called the Captain's Quarters. The rooms were open, airy and had wrap around windows with a stunning marina view. The balcony was huge, and wrapped around the whole unit. It had a table and 4 tables and was directly over the water. We sat out there on our second night and listened to the concert at Humphrey's for free. You can hear any show there just like you were in the venue itself. Once you go in and close the door though it's nice and quiet. The bed was super comfortable AND had a fitted bottom sheet. It's a pet peeve of mine, using a regular top sheet for a bottom sheet. Those always end up bunched up underneath me each time I roll over. The pillows were thick and perfect. The living room was huge with chairs and a comfortable couch and coffee table. The bathroom is 2 separate sections, with the sinks and mini fridge in one part and the bath/shower and toilet in the other. Both are in an area that can be closed off behind doors so an early riser can shower and get ready and not wake up a later sleeper. The room is very clean and comfortable and the staff was super helpful and friendly. The breakfast is free and while better then most free ones, the options are pretty limited. We also noticed that bottled beers at bar and soft drinks in the gift shop was not very cold. This could be because it was 85+ all 3 days we were there which is rare for downtown areas by the water. Onsite parking is only $5. Which is amazing! Hotels in San Diego (We live here and play tourist a lot! :) ) on average are $22-$25 per night for parking. $5 a night is just not found. You can park underground in a spacious lot or up top in the smaller lot in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: wgconrad
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to visit San Diego. A friend had recommended the Bay Club Hotel, so we chose to stay there. We were delighted when we arrived. This is a very family oriented hotel, reasonably priced, with great service. The front desk employees were more than helpful when asked about different attractions in the San Diego area. The restaurant staff was top notch; and the housekeeping staff was terrific. Our only complaint would be the hotel has a 4:00 p.m. check-in policy, and we arrived early morning and were not able to get into our room until 4:00. Other than that situation, there were no other problems. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to San Diego. I would give it 4 stars!!

Reviews.Title: “The Bay Club was a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: TigerBait
Reviews.Content: We got a late start on our vacation planning last summer, and all of the more popular or more highly rated hotels were booked when we were ready to make our reservations. I booked at the Bay Club with some trepidation after reading the mixed reviews on this site, but our experience there was very nice. We booked one of the executive suites on the second floor. The room was the largest of all the hotels we stayed in on our two-week trip. Our room was located directly above the dining area, and we had a nice view of the marina from the balconies. We watched the fireworks over SeaWorld in the distance on our second night there, and then were treated to the sounds of the Lonestar concert from next door later that night. But that was only on the balcony - you couldn't hear the concert once you closed the sliding doors. The breakfasts were nice and varied. They may not have been the gourmet buffets you will get at one of the hotels downtown, but they were much better than the simple fare you will get at many of the outlying hotels. I have stayed at a number of different San Diego locations over the years (my company has a conference out there every other year). This hotel is located in an area that's much less hectic than downtown, Mission Beach or Hotel Circle, but I didn't really notice an appreciable increase in the amount of time it took to get anywhere. As far as negatives for the hotel, the only one we experienced was the sofa bed, which was pretty bad. My teenage son was much more comfortable sleeping on the cushions on the floor than my daughter was in the bed. I can see how rooms on the first floor facing the street can get poor reviews, since you have people parking their cars right at your window. Definitely upgrade to a marina view room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place but ditch the Security guard!”
Reviews.Author: NurseMom115
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. We stayed here 4 nights while in town for my best friends wedding. They graciously extended the wedding rate for our entire stay which was nice. Rooms are immaculate. A little dated, but spotless! Plently of clean towels and extra pillows. Room was cleaned daily and sheets changed. The breakfast is AWESOME and TRUST ME...it is a FULL BREAKFAST. Some of the other reviews complain about the breakfast and it is very good, lots of variety. Ask for Jerry or Tom as a server because they are exxcellent and kept the coffee flowing. Jerry went out of his way to recommend some hot spots in the area and they all panned out to be great. The views are lovely and the area is beautiful. The pool and spa are great and we enjoyed a free concert by Boyz To Men who were performing next door at Humphreys. Plenty of parkinvg and reasonably priced too. I do believe that the 2nd floor is the place to be...my ONLY COMPLAINT was the wanna-be-cop Security Guard who really thinks he is Gods personal gift...NOT! Apparently, the people below us complained that my kids were being noisy and he showed up at the door like Rambo. We put the kiddies to bed and about 2 hours later, he called and woke us all up being obnoxious and threatening us that he has been up to our room once already and the noise better cease. My hubby explained that he is being misinformed as our entire family was sleeping. He continued on that this was his final warning. I immediately went down to the desk and demanded an explanation. He overheard me speaking to the guy at the front desk and came over and rudely interupted the young man behind the desk. He continued on that he did not mean to sound threatening but when other guests complain, etc. etc. I boldly pointed out that he was not threatening me in the least and the phone calls to my room had better stop as my family is sleeping and to take his wanna-be investigation elsewhere. He started babbling about his authority and I walked away. The next morning on our way to breakfast, the people in the room below us were leaving and my hubby approached them regarding their complaint. The man and woman said they could hear our TV and the kids runnning around the room. But they insisted they only called the desk once and the noise stopped. So Mr. Tough Guy Security Guard made the 2nd call up completely...which we knew anyway since we are all sleeping. My hubby also pointed out to the couple that it was not necessary to call the front desk at 8pm! But whatever. Upon check out the girl at the desk said they were high maintenance customers who complained about everything and ended up attempting to get their rate reduced...so it turned out they were con-artists. Regardless, the security guard is unprofessional in my book. Overall, I would stay there again...nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: susieq35
Reviews.Content: booked a room on the second floor for $10.00 more and it is worth the $10.00. Spacious room for family of 4. Room was clean with a microwave, coffee pot, iron/ironing board, blowdryer. Breakfast was very good, plenty of choices, nice waitrees, she kept the o.j and coffee coming. Nice view of the marina as well. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK..needs updating (Great waitress' though)”
Reviews.Author: KawiGirl
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: April 30, 2007 Hotel is OK, very clean, and location is great for walks, but the hotel is showing it's age. They also have problems verifying credit cards, so carry a back up in case their system won't connect to your cards clearing house. Waitresses were dynamic and the included breakfast is excellent- the best part of the stay. With a little renovation work, this could be a really nice hotel worthy of it's rates. We were in a second floor room with a marina view.. I don't think we would have been happy on the first floor.

HotelInfo.Name: Bay Club Hotel & Marina
HotelInfo.Address: 2131 Shelter Island Dr, San Diego, CA 92106
